Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a consultant for a long term mission or freelancer is also possible.

To start ASAP




We are seeking a talented LLM engineer to join our data science and software development team. The primary responsibility of this role to fine tune and implement pretrained Large Langue Models (LLMs). You further collaborate with various stakeholders to identify

other potential use cases. Once you've build a successful prototype, you work closely together with our software engineers to translate your Proof Of Concept (POC) into a mature software product. When more traditional natural language processing (NLP) algorithms suffice, you train, test and implement the appropriate models (e.g. named entity recognition, text classification or categorization, ...).







Key Responsibilities

brainstorm with stakeholders, identify potential use cases, document user and functional requirements
translate requirements into data pipeline, model and software architecture (you will be assisted by a data engineer and software architect)
fine tune and implement LLM models, test and optimize model performance
develop scalable, performant and reliable NLP algorithms
define, conduct and evaluate POCs
collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed LLM models and NLP algorithms in mature software applications




Skills & Qualifications

Master degree in computer science or related filed
7 years of work experience
proven experience developing NLP algorithms and implementing LLM technology
proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C++
experience with NLP frameworks and libraries (spaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, Hugging Face)
strong understanding of machine learning and deep learning techniques
strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
fluent in English and Dutch
analytical mindset, pragmatic problem solver
ability to collaborate in cross functional teams




Interested?

Please me your cv to anne@bimona.be

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
GigsRemote connects trusted companies with top tech contractors from Central and Eastern Europe, bringing them together to work on IT projects of varying complexity and duration. Our aim is to create an ongoing opportunity for gig talent allowing them to work from any location and set their own work-life balance focusing on projects they feel passionate about.




For one of our clients, we are looking for an AI Engineer on B2B contract.




Our client is focused on delivering scalable solutions, with accent on high quality and applying top-notch technologies. Proven experience with commercial AI projects is essential success in this project.




In this role you will be:

Collaborating closely with the team to design and develop AI proof of concepts and prototypes,
Create scalable version of the solution for successful POC.




You need to have:

Proven experience on a commercial AI project, preferably within energy sector,
Senior level of expertise in Python,
Experience with Llama Index and/or LangChain,
Experience in applying LLM,
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Excellent English language skills.




We offer short-term (two months) B2B contract, with potential to extend. This can be a full- or part-time remote role with working hours flexibility. Only contractors based in Europe will be considered.




If you are interested, apply here or register on our website and our Talent Advisor will get in touch with you to discuss further process.

  • Create scalable version of the solution for successful POC.


You need to have:

  • Proven experience on a commercial AI project, preferably within energy sector,
  • Senior level of expertise in Python,
  • Experience with Llama Index and/or LangChain,
  • Experience in applying LLM,
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
  • Excellent English language skills.


We offer short-term (two months) B2B contract, with potential to extend. This can be a full- or part-time remote role with working hours flexibility. Only contractors based in Europe will be considered.


If you are interested, apply here or register on our website and our Talent Advisor will get in touch with you to discuss further process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Middle Data Scientist




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong expertise with large scale Neural Networks, Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning techniques.
Experience with Probabilistic Graphical Modelling (Bayesian Networks, Markov Random Fields, Factor Graphs, ...)
Advanced knowledge of Python and machine learning frameworks (SciPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, pyMC, pgmpy, ...)
Hands-on experience with one or more cloud computing platforms (Azure - preferred, AWS, GCP).
Understanding of the whole ML lifecycle and experience with MLOps/DataOps.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Good communication skills, fluent English.







Remote vs Onsite: Remote, with possible occasional in person team sessions / workshops / gatherings (i.e. 1x quarter) likely to take place in Prague




Working hours needed: 9-6/10-7 CET

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Als ervaren data scientist puur je relevante inzichten uit de grote hoeveelheid data waarover Colruyt Group beschikt. Je maakt statistische modellen en geeft strategisch advies aan onze verschillende retailmerken. Het resultaat van jouw werk: een nog betere dienstverlening op maat van onze klanten.




Wat doe je concreet?




In de divisie Data & Analytics werk je in multidisciplinair team bestaand uit data science engineers, bi engineers, business analysts, … Samen bieden jullie analytische oplossingen aan voor de verschillende Colruyt Group merken, zoals Colruyt, Okay, Bike-Republic of Jims. In het data science kennisgroep worden ervaringen en kennis uitgewisseld. Op deze manier blijf je bijleren.
Als data scientist werk je samen met complementaire collega’s aan een brede waaier van projecten waarbij je in aanraking komt met nieuwe technieken en technologieën. We moedigen je ook aan om zelf, in overleg met het team, op zoek te gaan naar nieuwe methoden en technieken en zo de kennis en skills van de groep te vergroten. Naast een heel ruim aanbod aan interne opleidingen krijg je ook de kans om aanvullende opleidingstrajecten te volgen. Op die manier bouw je continu aan je business-kennis, je technische skills en je sociale vaardigheden.
Met het team focussen we enerzijds op onze interne klanten, de business-partners. We vertalen hun vragen in analytische projecten die we aanpakken in multidisciplinaire teams. Dat resulteert in een directe en nauwe samenwerking met ETL, software development en de businesspartner.
Anderzijds zijn we ook verantwoordelijk voor de identificatie van nieuwe analytics-opportuniteiten. We gaan proactief op zoek naar nieuwe inzichten die een toegevoegde waarde creëren voor onze partners. Daarbij kijken we uiteraard niet alleen naar Colruyt Group, maar volgen we ook de externe trends op het vlak van use cases rond analytics en technologische innovatie.
Colruyt Group bestaat uit veel verschillende entiteiten. Dat zorgt voor een enorme variatie en hoeveelheid aan data én use cases. De projecten waar je aan meewerkt gaan dan ook van klantensegmentatie over verkoopsprognose en analyse van winkeltesten tot operationele efficiëntie van machines, predictive maintenance en optimaal gebruik van grondstoffen.




Je werkt in Halle en kan tot drie dagen per week thuiswerken.




Profiel




Opleiding en ervaring – Je hebt een solide basis in handels- en of computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde of ingenieursstudies. Je hebt minstens 3 tot 5 jaar relevante ervaring.
ennis statistische modellering – Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van statistische modellering en kan deze implementeren in Python. Je hebt kennis van SQL en datavisualisatie-technieken.
Analytisch vermogen – Je slaagt erin om data te vertalen naar inzichten en je kan die ook helder en duidelijk communiceren.
Talenkennis – Kennis van het Nederlands is een must. Je praat zeer vlot Engels. Kennis van het Frans is een plus.




Wij bieden




Stimulerende werkomgeving – Je belandt in een ongelooflijk boeiende en rijke data-omgeving, krijgt ruimte voor initiatief en krijgt een brede kijk op het bedrijf.
Permanente leermogelijkheden – Je leert dagelijks bij en krijgt ook de kans om jouw talenten te ontwikkelen via interne en externe opleidingen. Op termijn zijn er ook reële doorgroeikansen.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een competitief loon met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, winstdeelname en maaltijdcheques.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future. With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, product designers, business consultants, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data-driven platforms, machine learning models, and innovative applications? As a Data Scientist/Engineer at Devoteam, you'll play a hands-on role in delivering impactful solutions across various clients and industries. Each mission we undertake has clear deliverables and deadlines, ensuring you gain diverse experience. For example, one month you might develop a predictive maintenance model, and the next, a customer segmentation model for a retail client.

Key Responsibilities:

Platform Setup: Design and implement robust data platforms using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud and Databricks.
Data Management: Gather, prepare, and manage data for analysis.
Model Research: Investigate and select appropriate machine learning models.
ML Modeling: Develop and refine machine learning models.
Client Collaboration: Spend approximately 50% of your time working directly with clients, either independently or as part of a team.



Your Role:

Build and maintain data platforms and pipelines using Azure, AWS or Google Cloud, Databricks, and Python.
Develop predictive and machine learning models tailored to client needs.
Advise clients on translating their business requirements into technical solutions using machine learning techniques.
Stay updated on the latest trends in machine learning and AI, sharing insights with clients.
Act as a strategic partner to client Data Science teams, helping them navigate their challenges and aspirations.
Inspire clients with new data-driven opportunities.
Bring best practices in Git, DevOps, and CICD to enhance client data platforms.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Stakeholders.
Represent Devoteam both online and offline, showcasing our expertise.


Qualifications

About You:

Reside in Belgium.
Hold a university degree in Computer Science, (Business) Engineering, or a specialized master's in Machine Learning or AI.
Have a solid understanding of various machine learning models (e.g., SVM, RNN, Deep Learning) and their applications.
Possess foundational knowledge of Data Science, including sampling techniques and evaluation metrics.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Experience with Spark and/or cloud ecosystems is a must.
Eager to learn and passionate about data and machine learning technologies.
Excited to join a dynamic and growing team.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory 



 


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Middle / Senior)
Description:
Company Intro




Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end data labeling solutions based on the effective combination of public crowd, domain experts and ML. Toloka has one of the most advanced annotation platforms in the market together with huge experience gathered by the whole team. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages and extensive experience in the practical application of SOTA models.




We bring together talents from all over the world to form our team of professionals. Our team is globally distributed and works from several locations, including the USA, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more.




We need an experienced and vigorous ML Engineer who will get the job done and enrich our team with knowledge, expertise, and experience.




Project Examples




Automating labeling quality control for collecting SFT (Supervised Fine-Tuning) datasets, focusing on challenges like instruction-following, logical consistency, and factual accuracy.
Building AI-assistants for labelers to streamline tasks like data annotation, evaluation, and quality assurance.
Researching and implementing strategies to optimize labeling order, speeding up model training cycles.
Generating and validating synthetic datasets for training models.




Responsibilities




Perform data exploration on human-labeled datasets generated from complex labeling pipelines.
Prototype and evaluate different approaches, such as prompt engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning pre-trained models, and training models from scratch.
Develop and deploy production-ready solutions.
Implement evaluation metrics and pipelines to measure model performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and open-source models in the ML community.
Work closely with non-technical team members to translate business needs into technical solutions.




Optional Skills and Experience




Experience with fine-tuning and evaluating large language models.
Hands-on experience in collecting human-labeled datasets and evaluation pipelines.
Fluency in English.




Team Philosophy




We are business-value focused, so hacking your way to solving problems is praised.
We work in a fast-paced environment, valuing quick decision-making, rapid iteration, and learning from mistakes.
Delivering top-tier data to our clients is central to our mission, so rigorously evaluating models is a big part of the job.
Overworking is not encouraged, so we focus on building low-cost/high-impact solutions that are sustainable and reusable.
ML components are part of larger data pipelines, so stepping outside your immediate scope and engaging with people outside the team can bring significant value.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong engineering skills with proficiency in Python, SQL, and commonly used ML frameworks/libraries.
Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including algorithms, model evaluation, and data preprocessing.
Experience in NLP (Natural Language Processing) or Computer Vision (CV).
Proficiency in English (B2+)




What we can offer




Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
Transportation expenses reimbursement;
Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
Contributions to personal pension plan.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (Contract)




We are looking for an AI Engineer with a strong foundation in AI, Machine Learning, and Computer Vision. This role centers around creating and fine-tuning advanced algorithms for edge devices, including integrating neural network models with embedded cameras and specialized processors.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement advanced algorithms for embedded cameras
Optimize AI models for edge devices
Document and share insights with the global AI team




Requirements:

4+ years in Data Science, AI, or related fields
Strong communication skills
Proficiency in C++ and experience with ML Ops, DevOps, and AI solutions
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest!

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.







What you’ll do:

You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success
You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for "what is possible" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients
You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures
You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help







Who you are:

You hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science (or related), and a master in Data Science / AI / Statistics or Machine Learning - or you have a proven track record in a similar role
You have a profound knowledge of Python and at least one of the most important machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch,...) and are able to work AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate and/or AI cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker or Azure AI Studio
You have relevant experience in going beyond running local ML experiments, but bringing ML to production, including MLOps, Data versioning, & LLM Orchestration frameworks
You have a broad awareness of the possibilities and limitations of ML, and see how Data and ML can help us build even better products for our clients.
You have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products
You highly value the principles of clean code, continuous improvement and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or devops practices is a plus
Any experience with the broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is a plus
You excel in sharing your knowledge with others, you enjoy coaching team members and helping them to gain more insights in your field of expertise







Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself.




On a personal level, we’re looking for someone who shares our values:




Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company
Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity
Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward
Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.
Show more
HTML:
Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest!

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.



What you’ll do:

  • You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success
  • You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for "what is possible" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients
  • You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures
  • You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help



Who you are:

  • You hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science (or related), and a master in Data Science / AI / Statistics or Machine Learning - or you have a proven track record in a similar role
  • You have a profound knowledge of Python and at least one of the most important machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch,...) and are able to work AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate and/or AI cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker or Azure AI Studio
  • You have relevant experience in going beyond running local ML experiments, but bringing ML to production, including MLOps, Data versioning, & LLM Orchestration frameworks
  • You have a broad awareness of the possibilities and limitations of ML, and see how Data and ML can help us build even better products for our clients.
  • You have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products
  • You highly value the principles of clean code, continuous improvement and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or devops practices is a plus
  • Any experience with the broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is a plus
  • You excel in sharing your knowledge with others, you enjoy coaching team members and helping them to gain more insights in your field of expertise



Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself.


On a personal level, we’re looking for someone who shares our values:


  • Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company
  • Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity
  • Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
  • Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward
  • Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs);
  • Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training pipelines;
  • Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuringscalability, performance, and reliability;
  • Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionalityacross platforms;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements andtranslate them into technical solutions;
  • Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross validation, and error analysis.


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning models and AI systems;
  • Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
  • Experience with data processing and ETL tools;
  • Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries;
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools;
  • Excellent command of the English language.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (17576/09/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VIATRIS BV

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Data Scientist role will make an impact:

Key Responsibilities for This Role Include:

Enhancing the advancement of CRM systems through the integration of AI technologies, the Data Scientist will support strategic decision-making by leveraging advanced data analytics, predictive models, and machine learning, ultimately enhancing business intelligence and operational efficiency.


Implement and integrate new versions and functionalities of existing CRM systems, in collaboration with Regional and Global teams, to bring system capabilities to the next level.
Manage and optimize the existing CRM systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date customer data.
Ensure that data management procedures are up-to-date and provide end-users training on CRM functionalities.
Analyse large and complex datasets using AI techniques to identify patterns and deliver insights for strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and AI-driven statistical analyses to support the transformation of business operations.
Perform regular data audits to identify and rectify inaccuracies or inconsistencies, ensuring higher data quality.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to communicate insights and performance metrics to internal stakeholders.



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Management, Marketing or a related field.
Minimum 3-5 years experience in supporting the business goals and needs.
Fluent in FR and/or NL, with strong EN capabilities
In-depth knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce, Veeva)
Good understanding of programming languages (Python, R, Java, or others)
Experience with Power BI
Experience in data management and model development
Strong business acumen and capability to translate business requirements into data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (MMM)
Description:
Position: Data Scientist

Location: Europe (Remote)




Experience:




3+ years of hands-on experience in data science roles with a focus on marketing mix modeling (MMM) for CPG/retail clients.
Strong understanding of marketing analytics and consumer behaviour in the CPG/retail space.




Technical Skills:




Proficient in statistical programming languages such as Python, R, or SAS.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and extraction.
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and libraries (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow).




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience working in a fast-paced CPG or retail environment.
Knowledge of econometrics and time series analysis.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP for data processing and model deployment.




Responsibilities:




Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM): Design, build, and validate marketing mix models to quantify the impact of marketing efforts on sales and ROI for CPG/retail clients.

Data Analysis & Insights: Leverage large datasets to identify trends, correlations, and key performance drivers in marketing campaigns and product performance.

Predictive Analytics: Use machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to forecast sales and marketing performance.

Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, finance, and data engineering teams to implement data-driven recommendations.

Data Preprocessing & Feature Engineering: Perform data cleaning, normalization, and transformation to prepare data for modeling.

Presentation of Findings: Communicate insights and actionable recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through dashboards, reports, and presentations.

Model Maintenance: Continuously improve and refine models to adapt to evolving business needs and external market conditions.




Contact Details: monarch.parmar@nityo.com

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Senior (Prompt Engineer)
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.




The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: Data Scientist - Senior (Prompt Engineer)

Location: Brussels

Type: Full time and Hybrid from Brussels




Power Skills:

You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.







We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to leverage new generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to enhance employee productivity and efficiency. The consultant will work closely with various business units, including marketing, sales, and back office, to identify use cases and implement AI-driven solutions that address specific business needs.




Function Description:

Design and create effective prompts using prompt engineering techniques to elicit optimal responses from generative AI tools.
Understand and translate business needs into actionable AI solutions by identifying use cases where generative AI tools can add value.
Test and evaluate the accuracy and quality of AI tool outputs using appropriate metrics and feedback loops.
Train and coach business users on effectively and responsibly utilizing AI tools, laying the groundwork for a prompt academy.
Document and communicate project results and insights clearly and effectively.







Technical and Soft Skills:

Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, mathematics, engineering) or an MBA. A PhD is considered an advantage. Candidates from other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of prompt engineering techniques are also encouraged to apply.
At least 4 years of relevant experience in Data Science and Analytics
Deep knowledge of generative AI tools such as ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, and Microsoft Office CoPilot, including the underlying principles of large language models.
Strong experience in advanced prompt engineering, including designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts for various tasks and domains.
Strong business understanding and stakeholder management skills.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and concisely.
Experience in the financial sector (is a plus)
Fluency in both French AND Dutch and English (mandatory)
Candidates must be in European Union already and have EU Passport / work permit in a European Union country (mandatory)




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.




@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Show more

  • Experience deploying machine learning in production
  • Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
  • Ability to write production ready code in Python.
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
  • Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
  • Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
  • Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
  • Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
  • Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
  • Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
  • Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus



What do we have to offer?

  • Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
  • In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
  • Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
  • In-company training adapted to your personal needs
  • Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
  • A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Description:
As a Data & AI Engineer, you will turn our customers’ ambitions into practical data and AI-driven projects. You are a tech-savvy process enthusiast, skilled in data management, and passionate about tackling intricate challenges. You will dive deep into a project's details to ensure its success.




Location: Main office in Kontich (BE), hubs in Ghent (BE) & Woerden (NL)




What you'll do




Understand the data ecosystem and its role in engineering and machine learning solutions.
Use enterprise knowledge and data to guide our clients toward data-driven decision-making.
Help stakeholders understand data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation, and reporting.
Bridge the gap between IT and business and drive organisational change with soft skills.
Drive client growth and transformation through your meaningful contributions.




What you're good at




You know how to work with the Microsoft Azure suite, Databricks, and Microsoft Fabric. Experience with visualisation tools is a big plus.
You know how to work with SQL and/or Python. Experience with writing ETLs and cloud computing is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills, and you love delving into details.
You have experience with business analytics and handling large sets of data.
You have excellent communication skills: you can effortlessly explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
You're intrigued by cutting-edge technologies such as generative AI.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or English. Proficiency in French is a big plus.




This could be you




I love showing our clients a new perspective on their business processes and helping them see how things really work. Add bullet point: make an impact at the client and help them grow/transform.

Title: Mid-Level Data Scientist Consultant - Banking & AI Focus
Description:
***Work permit for Belgium is required for this position***




About the role:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Scientist Consultant with 3-5 years of experience to join our growing team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on challenging and impactful projects for our banking and financial services clients. You will also contribute to internal initiatives focused on building AI solutions to expand the company’s offering.




About Sailpeak:

Sailpeak is a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation. With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.




Role and Responsibilities:

Client Consulting:

Partner with banking clients to identify and address their most pressing data-driven challenges.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to tackle a variety of use cases, such as risk assessment, fraud detection, customer churn prediction, and more.
Apply your expertise in AI, LLMs, and chatbot technologies to elevate client solutions.
Communicate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Internal Projects:

Spearhead the development of a comprehensive methodology and toolset for evaluating AI chatbot quality.
Stay at the forefront of chatbot quality assurance advancements through research and exploration.
Collaborate with internal teams to integrate and refine chatbot assessment processes.




Requirements:

Education:

Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.

Experience:

3-5 years of hands-on experience in data science, ideally within the banking or financial services sector.

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in Python and key machine learning libraries (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Expertise in AI, LLM, and chatbot technologies.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for model deployment and management.
Excellent data visualization and communication skills.

Language Skills:

Fluent in English, French, and Dutch.

Other Skills:

Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Passion for continuous learning and keeping up with the latest developments in AI and data science.




What We Offer:

A competitive salary and benefits package.
The opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients.
Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.
Mentorship and support from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.
A dynamic and collaborative work environment.




Interested?

Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak? To apply for this role, kindly send the following to [careers@sailpeak.com](mailto:careers@sailpeak.com):

Your up-to-date CV/resume.
A cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your pertinent qualifications.
Details of any academic or professional accomplishments or projects.




Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

Dataroots researches, designs and codes robust AI-solutions & platforms for various sectors, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As Machine Learning Engineer you are part of our dedicated in-house team of AI-specialists. You excel in building machine learning models which result in our robust and production-ready solutions to optimise company processes.

You love data and turning data inside out to reveal all its secrets. You are an expert in developing and implementing various statistical and machine learning models and you are in charge of controlling the performances of your models output. You love to experiment with different approaches to ensure your client the best-in-class solution. To achieve this, you collaborate closely with our data engineers and/or cloud architects on projects for various sectors, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. The result? Our teams provide clients a reliable foundation to make data-driven decisions.

As a senior, you will also build and share knowledge with your colleagues. Through a multitude of initiatives, you have various chances to share your knowledge and keep up to date with the latest developments in the field.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💪 The Skills

You have a knack for Machine Learning and have attained a Masters or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
You have a strong background and are opinionated on software design principles.
You have at least 2 years experience in a field related to machine learning and big data.
You have a strong theoretical basis and experience in general machine learning & deep learning.
You are excellent in Python. Experience in SQL is a big plus, knowledge of R or Scala is a bonus.
You have an initial experience in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
You have a basic understanding of cloud engineering.
You get excited by large amounts of data.
You approach problems with a pragmatic mindset.
You have strong communication skills and can translate complex solutions into clear and understandable explanations.
You have a good overview over the (big-)data ecosystem.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.




Was this list a bit much? Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

* An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.

* A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.

* Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.

* (Virtual) Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




🇧🇪 Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Title: Research and Development Data Engineer - Creating, managing and improving data pipelines for AI appl
Description:
I-care is a worldwide industrial service company specialized in predictive maintenance, reliability and Industry 4.0 solutions.

We are seeking an experienced (minimum 3 years of relevant experience) Data Engineer to join our I-care Augmented Intelligence research and development team of 4 people in Brussels, Belgium. (working from our offices in Leuven, Mons or Mechelen are also possible)

As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust data pipelines while leveraging cutting-edge technologies for helping our experts to focus on meaningful data that yields added value for our customers.

Responsibilities and Activities

Develop and maintain Gitlab CI/CD pipelines
Implement and manage Airflow workflows
Develop & maintain APIs using FastAPI
Interact with end-users an understand the business needs
Keep yourself updated about the state-of-the-art
Participate in technological decisions

Requirements

Relevant IT background education (3 yrs. min experience in Data Eng)
Proficiency in Python, Gitlab CI/CD pipelines, Docker Swarm, Airflow, MongoDB, SQL, Google BigQuery, and FastAPI
Experience in MLOps platforms and Kubernetes, Kubeflow, or Celery is a plus
Strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive mindset towards overcoming technical challenges
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Adaptability to learn and implement new technologies as per project requirements

What I-care offers you?

A chance to join a team that is working on some very exciting and innovative technologies used in Industry 4.0
A very attractive salary package
Company car with fuel card
Meal vouchers
Group insurance
Hospital insurance
Phone subscription
Internet at home
Cafetaria plan
Bonus system
Yearly evaluation

Become part of our success story!

I-care, a global leader in predictive and prescriptive maintenance since 2004. With over 800 dedicated technicians and engineers worldwide, we provide quality services and solutions that result in double-digit annual growth. At I-care, we value diversity and believe that everyone can make unique and valuable contributions. Join I-care and make a difference!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Responsibilities:

- Programming of software applications

- Proposition of trending software solutions and applications, best suited to the functional and technological needs

- Modelling, testing and integrating solutions into on-line environment

- Monitoring for the purposes of corrective and evolutionary maintenance

- Managing and coordinating workshops and project documentation

- Transfer of knowledge to the development team

- Constant dialog and support to the editorial team and conception team

- Ensure websites and software meet non-functional requirements (quality, security, performance, scalability, maintainability etc.)

- Experience in web development with HTML, Javascript (React.js) and CSS

- Experience with CI/CD (e.g. GitLab)

- Experience with cloud services (e.g. AWS) is a plus

- Excellent analytical skills

- Ability to work independently as well as in a team

- Affinity for agile methodologies

- Knowledge in Web accessibility is a plus

Title: Internship - Building Application Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for an exciting internship, in an engineering team working in digital projects ? Then we have a great opportunity for you as Building Application Engineer!

What will be your mission?

The Innovation Hub was inaugurated in March 2023. What it still lacks is visitor registration (preferably Planon), comfort sensors (CO2, VOC, temperature, humidity, ...) and 'people count' sensors that give us a real time insight into how the Innovation Hub is visited and what the impact is on the available space, air quality and facilities.

This insight is preferably presented on a large (touch) screen and an app. In this way, we show how an integrated workplace management system (IWMS, such as Planon) is used to support facilities management. The student can develop the project from A to Z according to interest in depth.

An example of a trajectory is: research smart workplace experience, feasibility study of sensors and software, working out a plan of approach and its realization. It goes without saying that the student will receive guidance depending on the phase in the track and the area of interest.

This will be discussed with the student in advance and a schedule will be drawn up.

Where? At Uccle

Duration? 3-6 months!

The internship is unpaid

You Are Someone Who Is


Enthusiastic and Driven: You have a go-getter attitude and a passion for success. Your interest in sales and eagerness to learn will set you apart.
Multilingual: French or Dutch speaker and a good command of English
Education: you currently study a Bachelor or Master’s degree in Facility Management or a related field.


The Process of recruitment:


A first contract with HR
An exchange with your tutor
An offer for the internship


Ready to Take the Next Step?

At Schneider Electric we believe in fostering a culture of growth and innovation. When you join us, you'll be part of a supportive and collaborative team that encourages your professional development. We provide comprehensive training and mentorship to help you excel in your role.

If you're ready to embark on an exciting journey with us and make a real impact in the world, apply now to join our team! Together, let's create a brighter future and unlock your full potential at Schneider Electric!

We are thrilled to receive your application and are looking forward to reviewing it!

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

Discover your Meaningful, Inclusive and Empowered career at Schneider Electric.

€34.2bn global revenue

+12% organic growth

135 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.

We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Python Software Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only

WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues




WHAT IS A PYTHON SOFTWARE ENGINEER AT CREAM?

As a Python Software Engineer, embrace your role and work with multidisciplinary teams on challenging projects as:

Reporting tools (finance…)
Web applications
Power calculation
Cloud migrations…




YOUR TASKS :

You define technical specifications
You develop and test new innovative tools
You maintain and support Python libraries with other developers
You coach users through ad-hoc training sessions and code reviews
You provide technological watch to keep up to date on state-of-the-art technologies




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You love designing, developing, testing and maintaining applications
You hold a Master’s Degree (civil engineer, software engineering…)
You are used to work with Python (Pandas, Numpy…) and C#
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

Bonus :

You have knowledge of technologies among Angular, Kubernetes, Dockers, Azure, Git…
You have IT Infrastructure knowledge

WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE THE LIME FLAVOUR?




A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

Title: Ormit Talent - Data Traineeship
Description:
Always had a thing for data? Time for the next step then. And go from curious data lover to curious data chief. In various roles at one or more companies. As a data analyst, data translator, business analyst, junior data scientist, ...




Because data is the new gold. If you know how to turn them into insights. That’s why more and more companies are investing in data. And in people who know how to handle them.







How special are you? Do the test.

You say oui and ja. You speak fluently French or Dutch. With a B1 level for the other.
A big passion for data is a big must. You don't need to be an expert in data just yet. We’ll help you become one. Just show us your affinity and above all: your passion!
Data tools are your middle name. Excel has no secrets for you, and other tools like Python, SQL or PowerBI sound familiar too. You just love to dive into all possible data tools.
You have a master or bachelor degree in a data-oriented field. Think civil or business engineering, mathematics, computer science, applied economics, statistics, IT,…
Or max 3 years work experience in analytics or a job filled with projects that triggered your passion for data, digital and tech.
You are curious (relentlessly). You want to know everything about as many things as possible. And if you don’t know it, you want to learn it. Comfort zones are a joke to you.







What’s in it for you? A killer combo of data and people skills

Discover your data thing: Find out which part you want to play in the data universe (and at which company). By doing and learning. And with our help.
Challenging projects: Switch roles, teams, companies and industries. In advanced data analytics, processing, project management, business analytics, … The common thread: data.
Boost your skills: Get ready to be amused and amazed with +20 tailored training days on data and people skills. Where you learn how to translate data into business reality.
Learn from senior experts: Who support and coach you during your assignments. And gladly share their knowledge on data and people skills with you.
Build connections : All those teams and companies, no wonder you’re left with a tremendous network. Not to mention your fellow special ones (and BFF’s).
Land in your dream job: Is there life after this traineeship? Absolutely! As a future proof data expert. And who knows, maybe even chief data officer ...
Enjoy the ride: Be part of a tight group of special ones. Instantly. Who you bond with for years to come. Thanks to our many events, workshops or during running.







How to become a data chief?

Discover in trainings how data skills (advanced analytics, functional analysis, visualisation, …) and people skills (communication, self-leadership, …) form a killer combo in your everyday work.
Work in data analytics, data management, data processing, business analytics, project management, data science, …
And then grow even further thanks to personal coaching and data mentoring







Ask us!

We bet you still have a lot of questions or could use our help. Tell us who you are and what you're looking for. One of our recruiters will get in touch.

Contact our recruiters : recruitment@ormittalent.be

Show more

Title: Data engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

Are you the Data Engineer who knows how to make a difference by preparing and transforming data from raw data into actionable data that helps create business value? Do you want to contribute to the energy transition with innovative data solutions and help our clients become data-driven organizations?

Your role in our team

At the heart of our efforts to accelerate the energy transition, you will play a vital role as a Data Engineer. Together with customers, colleagues and partners, you work on developing and implementing solutions that are not only technologically advanced, but also smart and sustainable. You do this by working closely together in a multidisciplinary team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Architects. You will contribute to building and maintaining robust data platforms and play a key role in the architectural design of new projects.

Together, you translate the latest trends in both the IT and energy industries into practical and innovative solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals. Your contribution will foster a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration, aimed at achieving the best possible results in our mission to support the energy transition with smart data-driven solutions.

How You Strengthen Our Team

You have a passion for data and innovation and are well-versed in the latest developments in your field. Data is your driving force. You are naturally curious, proactive and easily win others over to your ideas. In addition, you are active in sharing and developing your knowledge within your field. You have an Agile mindset and experience of working in an Agile environment.

Furthermore, we ask:

At least 5Y experience as a Data Engineer with a track record of designing, implementing, and optimizing data solutions.

Strong experience with AWS services such as S3, Athena, Glue, and Redshift, and effective experience in utilizing Databricks, preferably on AWS, for data processing and analytics.

Programming skills in Python, Spark, SQL, or another data engineering language, with the ability to develop and maintain complex data workflows and transformations.

Experience with data processing technologies and frameworks, along with a strong understanding of data architecture principles and best practices.

Knowledge of Agile processes such as Scrum or Kanban, with the ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment.

Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently to deliver high-quality data solutions.

Is a PLUS :

Experience in utilities market / Metering & allocation data management

Knowledge of technical systems like SAP ISU

Familiar with financial closing reports

Native Dutch or French with good communication in English

Education : Bachelor or master degree with a focus on Information Technology, or equivalent

A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

If you are passionate about application onboarding, thrive in a collaborative setting, and are ready to make a strategic impact, apply now and be a part of our team. Your journey towards shaping seamless application integrations starts here!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Consultant Services , Energy and Utilities, , bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
