Title: R&D Researcher - Pilot Plant Equipment owner
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Are you passionate about Innovation and making a difference?

Do you want to make an impact on products and services that affect consumers around the world?

Then apply today to learn more about the opportunities for you at P&G!

We are looking for an Electromechanical Professional Bachelor graduate with strong mechanical skills, to join us in our Brussels Innovation Center (located in Strombeek-Bever)!

You will become part of the Procter & Gamble R&D organization and you will have the opportunity to contribute to truly disruptive innovation challenges and apply into practice your thinking/analytical skills. As a result, we create new improved technologies and products for our consumers. The R&D pilot plant organization, where you will become part of, focuses on developing the know-how we need for designing the process & formulation to deliver the new inventions for all liquid F&HC brands, like Ariel, Dash, Dreft, Fairy,…

Within the R&D Pilot plant you will become the equipment owner for the Converter machine that can make the Ariel, Dash and Dreft Pods. The converter machine you will own is highly complex, technically challenging, and proprietary knowledge to P&G. It is critical to support all the global development for Fabric and Home care Unit Dose products. You will test new capabilities to improve the machines performance and test new Unit dose forms and shapes, while maintaining the machine in base condition. This work will be done in partnership with engineering, manufacturing and other R&D colleagues.

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success


Testing new technologies on the development Converter machine.
Maintaining the Converter Machine in base condition.
Troubleshooting unexpected transformations in partnership with R&D, Engineering & plant colleagues.
Executing & providing input to R&D learning plans.
Driving for continuous improvement.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


passionate about creativity and innovation;
a passion for Mechanical innovation and working with state-of-the-art capabilities
an Electromechanical Prof. Bachelor degree in
autonomous and have a real teamwork spirit.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for an experienced Data Engineer for a client of mine in the Brussels Region.




The ideal candidate will have strong experience with Delta Lake, Database assets, Data Modelling, Databricks and CI/CD pipelines.




The Role:




You will be focusing on using data to add value to the lives of customers and colleagues. Your mission will be to contribute to a centralized data warehouse and data lake and help the business teams with extracting insights from data. You will use your experience to work closely with other data engineers and architects to ensure that your setup is maintainable, scalable and in line with increasing business needs.




The Offer:




6-month contract
Up to €650 per day
Hybrid working in Brussels (2 days on-site)




Your Profile:




At least 4 years of relevant experience
Proficient in Python and SQL (DBT)
Relevant cloud experience (Azure preferred)
Experience with delta lake, database assets, data modelling techniques, CI/CD pipelines and Databricks
Native French speaking and Fluent English speaking




**Candidates MUST be based in Belgium or willing to commute 2 x per week**




If you are interested in this position please apply NOW, alternatively for more information feel free to get in touch by email: alex@kodastaff.be

Title: Manufacturing & Supply Chain Data Scientist
Description:
Are you willing to make a step in your career and deliver AI solutions from early discovery stages up to industrialized solutions as part of large transformation projects? Are you willing to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of production process or supply chain control solutions? If this is the case, this role will be of interest to you!

Your job

You are part of a team of a multi-disciplinary team and contribute to delivery excellence across client engagements:


Interact with client and Accenture functional and industry consultants to identify the Data science requirements and solutions to solve industrial problems or challenges
Drive the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline.
Develop, train and validate advanced analytics models,
Visualize the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.
Design and architect, build, test, deploy, maintain state-of-the-art and production grade ML/AI solutions
Be able to articulate and defend analytics solutions in front of Business and Technical Stakeholders
Collaborate with our international multi-disciplinary teams (expert & international delivery center) to bring the best-in-class expertise and delivery capacity as part of large data transformation projects
Use cloud native services from major cloud providers as well as custom implementations
Stay up to date on newest trends, techniques, tools, and methodologies
Demonstrate a high degree of ownership, accountability for your output and commitment to the task.



You drive and participate to internal initiatives across Research & Development, skills development, presales

You are very curious, connect and maintain relationship with our network of innovation centers, international practices, ecosystem to bring the best of our experience and differentiators to our clients and our people.

Your team

Accenture Applied Intelligence covers the range of Data and AI skills, from Strategy, Data Science, Data Architecture, AI Engineering and Visual Insights. It is also our approach to scaling AI for our clients. We embed AI-powered data, analytics and automation capabilities into business workflows to accelerate time to value. Our expertise in defining end-to-end strategy, combined with deep data infrastructure capabilities, cognitive services and industrialized accelerators help smooth clients' path to AI adoption, extending human capabilities and supporting clients in scaling AI responsibly. With 20K+ people around the globe, strong local practices and recognized as a leader by industry analysts, we collaborate with a powerful global alliance, innovation and delivery network to help clients deploy and scale AI within any market and industry.

Your background


Completed Master preferably in engineering or any other quantitative field with a strong focus on ML/AI, advanced analytics, data science, operations research.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in applying data & analytics techniques to manufacturing process & supply chain across one of the following industry: Life Science, Chemicals, Raw Materials Transformation, Goods manufacturing in environments related to operations
Proficient understanding of a few of the fundamental concepts related to plant data and information systems such as: automation systems, MES/DCS, machine sensorization, preventive or predictive maintenance strategies, line scheduling, OEE or equivalent metrics, quality processes, yield optimization, etc.
Excellent knowledge of at least one of the following programming language/frameworks: Python, R, Java, Matlab, SQL, Scala
Familiar with collaborative solutions, model & code versioning (Github), solution packaging (Docker)
Practical experience of cloud-based solutions is a strong plus.
Knowledge of Software Engineering standards and best practices is a strong plus
Knowledge of the AI/ML Model Lifecycle Management and tools including EDA, Modelling, Integration/Deployment, Data/Model drift detection, Model retraining, etc.
Up-to-date knowledge and skills in recent Machine Learning tools and techniques such as NN, NLP, Deep Learning, ...
Passion for Innovation, collaboration with eco-system and create value for our clients
Aptitude to interact with functional or business stakeholders who are not familiar with ML Engineering considerations.
Fluent in English, in Dutch and/or in French



Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you'll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we're really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.

We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:


13th month + holiday allowance
20 + 12 holidays
Laptop and smartphone
Hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package
Bonus program
Unique training & learning opportunities beyond your role specifics
Green mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,...
Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits tool
Discount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shops
Employee shares purchase plan
Eco-cheques
And many more!



Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description:
Full Stack Developer

Company: POLITICO

POLITICO is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our pioneering and growing media company in Brussels. Political decision-making is distributed, disorganized, and generally hard to follow at a larger scale, this is the issue we work on at POLITICO. By collecting, normalizing, organizing and thoughtfully presenting information we give individuals and organizations greater insight into political processes around the world.




What You’ll Do

As a full stack developer at POLITICO, you’ll work on all aspects of our stack ranging from data collection systems, REST and GraphQL APIs, background jobs, serverless applications, frontend single page applications, and cloud infrastructure. You will be an important player in an agile development team dedicated to building the technology that delivers our POLITICO Pro platform to policy professionals.




Our team holds itself to the highest standard and employs techniques such as conventional commits, continuous integration, test-driven development, infrastructure as code, and agile development with two-week sprints. We expect you to align with our core values and be a driving force towards further improvements of code quality and excellence in delivering our applications to customers.




What You’ll Need

Proven experience in building and working with large multi-service applications.
Fluency in English; any other European language is an asset.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Comfortable in an international environment.
Highly proficient in JavaScript, with a strong track record in web development, while demonstrating the ability to adapt to various programming languages as needed.
Experience with frontend frameworks like Vue or React.
Understand asynchronous concepts like message queues and service interoperability.
Having experience with cloud infrastructure (Amazon Web Services and infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform) is a bonus).
Experience with Kubernetes is a bonus.
Experience with React Native and Ruby on Rails is a bonus.




We Value Our People

Our benefits package is built for you, and includes:

Hybrid work: Whether you love company and enjoy collaborating with colleagues in person or want some time alone at home to get some deep work done.
Work from abroad days: Fancy a workday from atop a mountain resort, or want to work from your parent’s dining room table around the holidays? POLITICO offers the opportunity to work from abroad for a limited period each year.
Health and Wellness: Across the different cities where we have offices, we offer various initiatives that contribute to your well-being.
Transportation: Say goodbye to traffic jams and hello to smooth commutes. POLITICO partially covers public transportation costs.
Personal and Professional Growth: From dedicated pieces of training to regular career chats, with our Grow@POLITICO program, we put your professional development and growth first.




About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, Paris, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.




Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Show more

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
About the Company

CrypDefi is a secure gateway platform between custody & DeFi. It enables companies to instantly capture alpha on new chains or DeFi, without any counterparty risk. CrypDefi immediately integrates major custodians with brand-new DeFi, and facilitates asset bridging across wallets & chains. It signs transactions for any chain, and supports new ones within a week.




What we're building

A middleware layer that interacts through API calls with all the big crypto custodian platforms (Fireblocks, ForDefi, BitGo, Copper, …).
A frontend, single-pane-of-glass visualization offering a complete overview of our client's assets, transactions, usage, …
Our own MPC & high-frequency omni-chain signing solution.
Automation flows to seamlessly create wallets, move assets between wallets, transfer funds across custodians, bridge assets across chains, …




What we look for in you

You're passionate about writing code, and have at least 2 years of experience in 2 of the following tech stacks: Golang, C++, React, Next.js, Rust, Kubernetes. If you're an amazing code wizard in another language, please let us know!
You have relevant web3 experiences to showcase, or are highly interested in web3.
You're an enthusiastic person with a 'can do' mind-set. Challenges don't scare you, but 100% excite you!
You're proactive & self-driven to work in remote environments and deliver. However, always welcome at our office in Brussels.
You appreciate candid feedback & direct communication. Of course, this goes both ways, and we will be more than happy to also learn from you!
You're able to think along our vision, identify potential gaps & build solutions. We're not looking for someone who just completes tasks, rather someone who can take ownership & responsibility of their own stream, build it and help us reach our goals.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto evolves all the time, and so can our priorities. What you've worked on in the past might not be what you will be working on tomorrow. You're not looking for a boring job; this excites you.
You embrace the startup lifestyle and have a work hard play hard mentality. You're able to see bigger picture and are willing to go the extra mile.
You're a winner.

Bonus:

You're a front-end god with knowledge on design and UX.




What we offer

Salary: the salary range will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills.
Stock options: as a startup, we want to give you ownership of the company to make sure our goals are yours as well.
Remote working possibility: although we prefer candidates that are able to meet in Brussels at least every once in a while, we are open to discuss.
Rapid learning & growth: every day will be different, and as one of our first employees you'll have every chance to grow with the company.
Stellar team: the opportunity to work with 3 top-of-the-class engineers from Belgium, with contacts & investing execs from major industry players.
Show more

Title: HRIS Python Developer
Description:
Location: Brussels

Contract type: Open ended contract – Full-time

Deadline for application: 19th of September 2024




CONTEXT

MSF OCB replaced its HR Information System in June 2023 and has chosen the Odoo Enterprise edition Version 15 for building its new software.

The HRIS is used by 5000 users that are 2000 employees currently under MSF contract and 3000 persons that have either not yet worked for MSF or are in between MSF contracts.

The 2000 employees will access the backend of Odoo and the 3.000 non-employees will access the Odoo solution via a self-service web portal.

MSF has the support of an Odoo integrator - Niboo - to develop and customize the standard Odoo Enterprise edition in accordance with our specific needs.

As a software developer skilled in Python you will reinforce its existing HRIS Team composed of developers, business analysts, data analyst.




MAIN RESPONSABILITIES

Develop and customize the Odoo enterprise edition V15 backend and web-portal to meet the needs of our users. The focus will be set on debugging existing customized modules as well as on implementing new features for HR department
Follow best practices, under the supervision of the HRIS coordinator and with the support of our integrator, in software engineering to ensure the software developments are correctly documented and easy to migrate to future Odoo enterprise versions
Share knowledge about the developed python code with the other members of the HRIS Team.
Collaborate with the ICT unit
Ensure that MSF has a degree of independence from our integrator for any further development once the main development project is finished







REQUIREMENTS

Education & Experience

Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management or related fields is an asset
Proven knowledge and experience of Python
Understanding and experience with object-oriented development
Experience with relational databases, preferably PostgreSQL
Experience in large projects
Experience in IT support is an asset
Experience in Test Automation is an asset
Contribution to Open Source Projects is an asset
Experience with MSF is an asset




Competencies

Understanding and experience with object-oriented development
Basic understanding of web development
Knowledge of Version Control tools like Git
Passion for development
Quick & Autonomous learner
Fluent in English and French
Good team player
Good communication skills
Willing to work in an international, multidisciplinary and humanitarian environment
Knowledge of Odoo framework is an asset
Knowledge of Docker & container management is an asset
Knowledge of JavaScript and JavaScript libraries is an asset
Knowledge of API developments over XML-RPC is an asset
Knowledge of several programming languages is an asset
Knowledge of Linux is an asset




Languages

Fluent in English and French (oral & written)




CONDITIONS

Expected Starting date: November 2024
Location*: Brussels (Belgium)
Contract type: Open-ended contract – Full-time
Salary according to MSF-OCB HQ grid
Meal Vouchers - Hospital Insurance (DKV) – Pension Plan – 100% reimbursement for public transportation costs
Adhere to the MSF principles and to our managerial values: Respect, Transparency, Integrity, Accountability, Trust and Empowerment
Adhere to the MSF Behavioral Commitments







Deadline to apply: 19th September of 2024




How to apply?




Online applications to be submitted by 19/09/2024 the latest via the following link. After clicking on this link, you will be directed to our online application tool.




Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.




MSF values diversity and is committed to create an inclusive working environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of disability, gender identity, marital or civil partnership status, race, color or ethnic and national origins, religion or belief, or sexual orientation.




The protection of your personal data is important to MSF. By submitting your application, you consent to MSF using your personal data. For more information, consult our privacy notice to job applicants.

Show more

Title: ServiceNow Developer (FR & EN)
Description:
Job Description



Mission Context


The Configuration & Asset Management squad is responsible for the platform support and development of service management tools implemented in ServiceNow as a SaaS solution. In addition to ITSM, a dedicated IT instance of ServiceNow is being established to develop CMDB and Application Referential tools using the AppEngine module, replacing legacy systems.


Function Description


As an expert in the ServiceNow platform, your responsibilities will include:


Managing stakeholder expectations in alignment with delivery capabilities
Guiding stakeholders in refining their requirements, encouraging the use of out-of-the-box ServiceNow functionality, and setting realistic delivery timelines
Conducting functional and technical analysis based on business requirements
Performing ServiceNow development and configuration activities
Coaching internal team members in acquiring ServiceNow development, configuration, and support skills
Taking initiative to improve data quality


Qualifications



Experience:


5+ years of relevant experience
3+ years of ServiceNow experience, with knowledge of AppEngine and ITSM module (CMDB)
Experience in ServiceNow introduction projects is a plus
Expertise in agile methodologies
Experience in business, functional, and technical analysis

Languages:


English & French: Required
Dutch: Asset

Education: Bachelor/Master or equivalent experience in IT


Soft Skills:


Team player with a proactive attitude
Strong coordination, communication, and influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomous, committed, and persevering
Ability to work in a dynamic and multicultural environment
Results-oriented and stress resistant


Additional Information


Work Location: Brussels, with occasional travel to Paris
Telework: 50% on-site, 50% remote
Show more

  • Coaching internal team members in acquiring ServiceNow development, configuration, and support skills
  • Taking initiative to improve data quality

Qualifications

  • Experience:

    • 5+ years of relevant experience
    • 3+ years of ServiceNow experience, with knowledge of AppEngine and ITSM module (CMDB)
    • Experience in ServiceNow introduction projects is a plus
    • Expertise in agile methodologies
    • Experience in business, functional, and technical analysis

  • Languages:

    • English & French: Required
    • Dutch: Asset

  • Education: Bachelor/Master or equivalent experience in IT

  • Soft Skills:

    • Team player with a proactive attitude
    • Strong coordination, communication, and influencing skills
    • Good analytical and synthesis skills
    • Autonomous, committed, and persevering
    • Ability to work in a dynamic and multicultural environment
    • Results-oriented and stress resistant

Additional Information

  • Work Location: Brussels, with occasional travel to Paris
  • Telework: 50% on-site, 50% remote

Title: Automotive Security Researcher
Description:
Automotive Security Researcher - Hybrid - Brussels, Belgium - Contract




A research and development lab in Brussels has been providing offensive security services to global business units since 2011. Our team specializes in evaluating a wide range of consumer electronics, professional devices, and online services to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities. Many of the products listed on leading tech platforms have been rigorously tested in our lab.

We are currently looking for an experienced automotive security researcher to join our team.

Our lab performs independent security assessments on a variety of products by conducting vulnerability research, reverse engineering, and penetration testing. We also develop specialized tools to streamline and automate these research processes. Additionally, we compile and organize knowledge about existing vulnerabilities and potential threats across multiple product lines.




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct hands-on security testing and reverse engineering, with black, grey, or white box approaches, depending on the project.
Perform vulnerability research on embedded devices (primarily ARM-based), including automotive-specific components and products.
Review security-related source code (mainly in C/C++).
Develop security assessment tools and proof-of-concept (PoC) demonstrations for identified vulnerabilities.
Write detailed vulnerability reports and provide guidance to development teams on remediation.
Identify security threats and weaknesses in products, and propose countermeasures.
Document research findings in the form of guidelines, checklists, and best practices for development teams.




Qualifications:

Proficiency in reverse engineering tools and techniques, such as debuggers, decompilers, disassemblers, deobfuscators, static and dynamic binary analysis, and packet sniffers.
Experience in testing automotive products, including Android Automotive OS, real-time operating systems, and Qualcomm platforms.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in C and assembly programming.
Experience with Linux environments and fluency in English.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of anti-tamper tools and techniques.
Familiarity with hardware attack vectors and malware analysis.
Understanding of cryptographic algorithms (RSA, SHA, AES, etc.).
Knowledge of Android/iOS security architectures.
Understanding of networking protocols such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

Title: Full-stack Developer
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for a Full-stack Developer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Read and understand executable BPMN2.0 specifications, UML models as well as functional and technical requirements;
  • Design and develop APIs;
  • Creation of micro services and databases for functionality;
  • Design and implementation of data storage solutions;
  • Integration of DevOps pipelines;
  • Prepare and implement Test scenarios and cases;
  • Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.


Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 13 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Experience with micro-frontend architecture patterns;
  • Experience with Angular 14+ framework and Typescript;
  • Experience with CSS/SASS, HTML5, and SVG;
  • Experience with process analysis for streamlining and automation;
  • Experience with Camunda framework to apply executable BPMN specification subset restrictions and Camunda specific configuration;
  • Experience with using Java, Spring & Spring Boot, Kafka Message Broker, Relational DB Oracle, Elastic Search;
  • Experience with JavaScript (specificities of ES6 and TypeScript);
  • Experience with Web vulnerabilities, including Cross site scripting and Cross site request forgery;
  • Experience with middleware integration platforms;
  • Experience with micro-services, macro-services and event-driven based architectures; 
  • Experience with Client-side Single Page Application development;
  • Experience with big UI projects: multi-modules, multiple target devices- Maintenance of a large codeset;
  • Experience with NodeJS development and dependency management;
  • Experience with authentication systems based on SSO and CAS: Session cookie management through REST API, session time-out state recovery;
  • Experience with the following tools: GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, Nexus, Crucible, Jenkins and Sonar;
  • Good knowledge of DevOps pipelines;
  • Knowledge and understanding of cloud architecture pattern and integration tools (AWS/Microsoft Azure);
  • Familiarity with the contemporary tools and techniques for process automation as well as Business Process Management and Modelling techniques, BPMN 2.0 specification;
  • The following would be considered as an asset:

- Knowledge of Redux architecture with NgRx and state management;

- Knowledge in PWA development using Ionic/Angular;

- Knowledge of middleware integration platforms, micro-services, macro-services and event-driven based architectures;

- Development knowledge, in particular with Java Spring and Angular;

- Modern DevSecOps Experience with Docker and Kubernetes;

- Experience with Compass Corporate, API Gateway, Secunda+, Dynamic Forms and Kafka;  

- Experience with ARIS (EA/BPM tool);

  • Excellent command of the English language.

Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: (93569/09/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com)is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using integrated state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents..

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are looking for a .NET Developer to join one of our key projects in the energy sector. As part of a diverse and inclusive team, you will contribute to building a sustainable, green, and reliable energy infrastructure that supports economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint. You’ll collaborate with internal staff and other external team members to drive innovative solutions forward in a rapidly evolving landscape.




🤖 Responsibilities and Requirements:

Collaborate within a dynamic team to develop and maintain high-quality, sustainable code following Elia's standards.
Work on a .NET product centered around Identity Access Management (IAM) and Customer IAM (CIAM) frameworks.
Implement new features and functionalities using .NET 8, VueJs, and Blazor.
Manage databases using SQL Server and MongoDB, ensuring system reliability and performance.
Support CI/CD pipelines through Azure DevOps Server, ensuring smooth and efficient product releases.
Integrate messaging systems using RabbitMQ to enhance system communication.
Assist in writing and running automated tests using Cucumber with Java to ensure high-quality code.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions, contributing to testing, defect management, and continuous improvement processes.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Strong experience in .NET 8, VueJs, Blazor, and Azure DevOps Server.
Solid knowledge of SQL Server, MongoDB, and RabbitMQ.
Familiarity with IAM/CIAM, OpenID Connect (OIDC) protocols, and cloud-based identity models in B2B/B2C environments (preferably on Azure).
Familiarity in Java for Cucumber automated testing.
Excellent communication skills with accountability for tasks and deliverables.
Proficiency in English, along with Dutch or French, with a passive understanding of the other language.




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.




📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
🚗 Company car
🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
🍽️ Meal voucher
🏠💼 Hybrid working: 2-3 days per week at the office in Brussels




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting







Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: Back End Developer
HTML:
Description

We currently have a vacancy for a Backend Developer fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company’s premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client’s IT team on site.

Your tasks:

  • Read and understand executable BPMN2.0 specifications, BPMN and UML models, functional and technical requirements;
  • Apply implementation best practices, and existing functional requirements for back-end using project selected technologies;
  • Design and develop APIs, create scalable software, and implement data storage solutions;
  • Creation of micro services and databases for functionality, and integration of DevOps pipelines;
  • Compile and analyze data, processes, and codes to troubleshoot problems and identify areas for improvement;
  • Testing and fixing bugs or other coding issues, along with preparation and implementation of test scenarios and cases;
  • Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.

Requirements

  • University degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 13 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Strong expertise with middleware integration platforms, micro-services, macro-services and event-driven based architecture;
  • Strong expertise using Java, Spring & Spring Boot, Kafka Message Broker, Relational DB Oracle, and Elastic Search;
  • Strong expertise in process analysis for streamlining and automation;
  • Strong knowledge and experience with Camunda framework to apply executable BPMN specification subset restrictions and Camunda specific configuration;
  • Experience with GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, Nexus, Crucible, Jenkins and Sonar;
  • Good knowledge of architecture best practices and patterns, microservices and architecture in the cloud;
  • Good knowledge of Event Driven architecture, Event Sourcing and CQRS;
  • Good knowledge of application design, modelling tools and standards (BPMN);
  • Good knowledge of Relational DBMS AND DevOps pipelines;
  • Knowledge of interoperability technology (web services, message oriented middleware, service oriented bus, event architecture);
  • Familiarity with contemporary tools and techniques for process automation, Business Process Management and Modelling techniques, and BPMN 2.0 specification;
  • Experience with Modern DevSecOps, Docker, Angular Kubernetes,ARIS, and Graph Databases would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions, a Tobania Company, is currently looking for a Cloud/DevOps Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our clients on a medium to long-term basis. All candidates need working proficiency

in English, knowledge of Dutch and French is a plus.

As a Cloud Engineer, you will help our clients with setting up infrastructure for a variety of data applications. Additionally, you’ll support our data scientists and engineers by

implementing tools and applying best-practices to achieve a more efficient workflow.

More Specifically, The Responsibilities Include


Set up, monitor and maintain cloud scalable infrastructure across different industries
Design and deploy data solutions: Data Science, Machine Learning, data pipelines
Use infrastructure as code (IaC) to manage infrastructure
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate testing and deployments
Identify design and implement process improvements: automating manual processes, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise


Who are we looking for?

Required


Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field
At least 3 years of experience as a Cloud or DevOps Engineer or similar position
Operational experience deploying modern data applications.
Solid experience with Infrastructure as Code and Automation (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, ARM)
Experience with containers and container orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience with networking, IAM, security, RBAC
Strong knowledge of CI/CD (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitLabCI, Jenkins, GitHub Actions)
Experience securing cloud environments
Solid understanding of GNU/Linux, command line shell, and scripting.
Programming experience with one or more languages (e.g., Python, Java, Go)
In depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider (GCP, AWS or Azure). Certifications from any of these is considered a plus.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively.
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.


Bonus


Experience with MLOps
Affinity with Data Science, Machine Learning Engineering and/or Data Engineering
Experience with hybrid (cloud/on premises) solutions


What do we have to offer?


Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development.
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values
A workstation at one of our customers’ offices, at Python’s Brussels office but also at any Tobania’s location!


Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Service Engineer
Description:
VINCI Facilities draagt zorg voor gebouwen, eindgebruikers en het milieu. Als onderdeel van de groep VINCI Energies, is VINCI Facilities een belangrijke speler op het gebied van Facility Management en Multi Technisch beheer.

VINCI Facilities biedt een volledige waaier aan onderhoudsdiensten aan, met inbegrip van het beheer en de exploitatie, systematische en voorwaardelijke correctief- en preventief, onderhoud. Daarnaast biedt VINCI Facilities ondersteuning op lange termijn met facilitaire oplossingen op maat. Dankzij onze jarenlange ervaring bij onze klanten, hebben we ook een team van interieurarchitecten om kantoren in te richten volgens de New Way of Working.

Bij VINCI Facilities zorgen onze professionele experten voor een kwaliteitsvol onderhoud op alle technische installaties in gebouwen. Onze techniekers werken in de eigen regio binnen heel wat verschillende gebouwen zoals scholen, kantoren of ziekenhuizen. Door onze aanhoudende groei zijn we op zoek naar een Service Engineer om onze collega's te begeleiden op technisch vlak.

Service Engineer, what's in a name? Wel, je bent verantwoordelijk voor de planning en uitvoering van onderhoudswerken voor verschillende klanten in regio Vilvoorde - Halle. Je staat jouw 10 collega's bij met technisch advies met als doel de gebouwen in topconditie te houden!

Wat zal je doen?

Een Greep Uit Je Takenpakket


Coördineren en opvolgen van preventief en/of correctief onderhoud, spin-offs en add-ons, inclusief het plannen van dagelijkse en wekelijkse werkzaamheden in samenwerking met de service desk.
Verzorgen van externe communicatie: rapporteren aan de klant over bezoeken en conclusies, en zorgen voor een correcte naleving van procedures bij de klant.
Verzorgen van interne communicatie: samenwerken met de service desk voor de planning en voorbereiding en je rapporteert aan de Contract Manager die trouwens ook op de site aanwezig is.
Opvolgen van technici en bieden van ondersteuning. Je zorgt ervoor dat de juiste persoon op de juiste taak wordt ingezet en vraagt opleidingen aan op basis van behoeften. Uiteraard zorg je voor een optimale sfeer binnen jouw team.
Onze collega's zijn goud waard, daarom zie je erop toe dat de veiligheidsrichtlijnen worden nageleefd.


Jij bent de ideale Service Engineer als je…


Je bent in het bezit van een Bachelordiploma in een technische richting en kan ervaring aantonen binnen de HVAC-sector.
Een brede kennis, maar vooral interesse hebt in technologie en HVAC. In één oogopslag kan jij een probleem analyseren en er de geknipte oplossing voor bedenken.
Ben je in het bezit van certificaten (GI/GII/koelcertificaten/VCA/…)? Dan is dat zeker een troef!
Vlot kan communiceren in het Nederlands. Beheers je daarnaast ook het Engels, dan is dat een plus!
Bekend staat voor je nauwkeurigheid en organisatorische vaardigheden. Iemand gestructureerd en met oog voor detail, dat is wat we zoeken.
Gedreven en klantgericht bent. Jij gaat tot het uiterste voor een tevreden klant!


Kies je voor VINCI Facilities, dan kan je rekenen :


Op een boeiende functie binnen een stabiele en internationale onderneming.
Op aangename collega's en verantwoordelijken, die bereikbaar en behulpzaam zijn.
Een omgeving waar we een goede work-life balance voorop zetten.


We bieden je een persoonlijk groeitraject met verschillende opleidings- en groeimogelijkheden waardoor je kan uitblinken in jouw talenten.

Uiteraard bieden we aantrekkelijke loonsvoorwaarden en een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen:


Smartphone + abonnement
Tablet
Verlof: 32 dagen/jaar (12 extra ADV + 20 vakantiedagen)
Groepsverzekering
Hospitalisatieverzekering
Ecocheques
Wachtpremie
CAO 90 (collectieve bonus in februari)
Kortingen bij onze partners
Opleiding en groeimogelijkheden
Bedrijfswagen en tankkaart
...


VINCI Facilities streeft naar een weerspiegeling van de Belgische, diverse samenleving. We moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren (ongeacht origine, huidskleur, leeftijd, geslacht, etc.)!

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Onze techniekers werken in de eigen regio binnen heel wat verschillende gebouwen zoals scholen, kantoren of ziekenhuizen. Door onze aanhoudende groei zijn we op zoek naar een Service Engineer om onze collega's te begeleiden op technisch vlak.

Service Engineer, what's in a name? Wel, je bent verantwoordelijk voor de planning en uitvoering van onderhoudswerken voor verschillende klanten in regio Vilvoorde - Halle. Je staat jouw 10 collega's bij met technisch advies met als doel de gebouwen in topconditie te houden!

Wat zal je doen?

Een Greep Uit Je Takenpakket

  • Coördineren en opvolgen van preventief en/of correctief onderhoud, spin-offs en add-ons, inclusief het plannen van dagelijkse en wekelijkse werkzaamheden in samenwerking met de service desk.
  • Verzorgen van externe communicatie: rapporteren aan de klant over bezoeken en conclusies, en zorgen voor een correcte naleving van procedures bij de klant.
  • Verzorgen van interne communicatie: samenwerken met de service desk voor de planning en voorbereiding en je rapporteert aan de Contract Manager die trouwens ook op de site aanwezig is.
  • Opvolgen van technici en bieden van ondersteuning. Je zorgt ervoor dat de juiste persoon op de juiste taak wordt ingezet en vraagt opleidingen aan op basis van behoeften. Uiteraard zorg je voor een optimale sfeer binnen jouw team.
  • Onze collega's zijn goud waard, daarom zie je erop toe dat de veiligheidsrichtlijnen worden nageleefd.

Jij bent de ideale Service Engineer als je…

  • Je bent in het bezit van een Bachelordiploma in een technische richting en kan ervaring aantonen binnen de HVAC-sector.
  • Een brede kennis, maar vooral interesse hebt in technologie en HVAC. In één oogopslag kan jij een probleem analyseren en er de geknipte oplossing voor bedenken.
  • Ben je in het bezit van certificaten (GI/GII/koelcertificaten/VCA/…)? Dan is dat zeker een troef!
  • Vlot kan communiceren in het Nederlands. Beheers je daarnaast ook het Engels, dan is dat een plus!
  • Bekend staat voor je nauwkeurigheid en organisatorische vaardigheden. Iemand gestructureerd en met oog voor detail, dat is wat we zoeken.
  • Gedreven en klantgericht bent. Jij gaat tot het uiterste voor een tevreden klant!

Kies je voor VINCI Facilities, dan kan je rekenen :

  • Op een boeiende functie binnen een stabiele en internationale onderneming.
  • Op aangename collega's en verantwoordelijken, die bereikbaar en behulpzaam zijn.
  • Een omgeving waar we een goede work-life balance voorop zetten.

We bieden je een persoonlijk groeitraject met verschillende opleidings- en groeimogelijkheden waardoor je kan uitblinken in jouw talenten.

Uiteraard bieden we aantrekkelijke loonsvoorwaarden en een uitgebreid pakket extralegale voordelen:

  • Smartphone + abonnement
  • Tablet
  • Verlof: 32 dagen/jaar (12 extra ADV + 20 vakantiedagen)
  • Groepsverzekering
  • Hospitalisatieverzekering
  • Ecocheques
  • Wachtpremie
  • CAO 90 (collectieve bonus in februari)
  • Kortingen bij onze partners
  • Opleiding en groeimogelijkheden
  • Bedrijfswagen en tankkaart
  • ...

VINCI Facilities streeft naar een weerspiegeling van de Belgische, diverse samenleving. We moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren (ongeacht origine, huidskleur, leeftijd, geslacht, etc.)!

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Junior Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Technology Strategy

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.

Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

We’re looking for a talented Junior Data Analytics Consultant to join our Technology Consulting department as of September 2024.

Your impact

As a Data Consultant, you’ll make an impact by:


Help clients by providing efficient data analysis to reach a better understanding of their business
Guide clients from strategy through execution when facing digital challenges
Leverage the value of enterprise knowledge and big data to help clients evolve towards insights-driven organisations by going through the whole “data” range: data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation and reporting
Enable business growth for our top tier clients and create unique experiences for their people and customer base
Use your knowledge and expertise to contribute to the success of our projects with and for our clients


About You


You have a bachelor’s or a master’s degree in business, data analytics, informatics, engineering or computer sciences, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in technologies and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French
You are creative and eager to solve challenging problems
You have an analytical mindset, a can-do attitude and great communication skills
You enjoy being client facing as from day one
You are eager to work in multi-disciplinary teams with consultants from various backgrounds, while also being able to work flexible and independently
You are keen to take on new challenges and to continuously learn
You are sociable and communicative, while embracing an inclusive environment
You are people-oriented and look forward to being part of an international family
You are looking for lifelong experience as well as a learning from failure culture


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.


Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred: Master Degree - Data Analytics

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

AI Systems, Business, Data Analytics, Data Science, Python (Programming Language), Structured Query Language (SQL)

Optional Skills

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Dutch, English, French

Travel Requirements

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

Government Clearance Required?

Job Posting End Date

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
🚀 We're Hiring: LOGFAS Full Stack Developer 🚀

Location: Belgium

Start Date: 21/10/2024

Contract Length: 3 sprints in 2024, 25 sprints in 2025 and 2026

Join our dynamic team and play a key role in supporting and updating LOGFAS software modules! As a Full Stack Developer, you’ll be instrumental in:

🔹 Developing and enhancing LOGFAS software modules

🔹 Participating in agile meetings and sprint activities

🔹 Creating and implementing test cases

🔹 Supporting bug fixes and stability improvements

🔹 Working on application data models, APIs, web services, and more!

Requirements:

✅ University degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent

✅ 5+ years of experience with .NET Framework, Entity Framework, C#, ASP.NET, Ext JS, Angular

✅ Experience with OpenID Connect (OIDC), WSO2, ADFS, JWT, and SAML

✅ Proficiency in Visual Studio, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server

✅ Strong skills in asynchronous programming, Git, Design Thinking, and Agile

✅ Cloud computing experience with Microsoft Azure

✅ Fluent in business English

Why Join Us?

Be part of an innovative team in a multinational environment where your expertise will make a real impact!

Apply Now and take your career to the next level! 💼✨

Note: Security clearance is not required.

Title: Web Developer
Description:
For one of our client at the European Parliament we are looking for a Web Developer.




The web developer will be responsible for contributing to the implementation of the European Parliament's websites as well as of all supporting applications and platforms essential to ensure the publication of multilingual content on Internet.




The services include:




Programming of software applications
Proposition of trending software solutions and applications, best suited to the functional and technological needs
Modelling, testing and integrating solutions into on-line environment
Monitoring for the purposes of corrective and evolutionary maintenance
Managing and coordinating workshops and project documentation
Transfer of knowledge to the development team
Constant dialog and support to the editorial team and conception team
Ensure websites and software meet non-functional requirements (quality, security, performance, scalability, maintainability etc.)




The following qualifications, experience and skills are required:




Excellent knowledge in web development with various frameworks and platforms like SpringBoot
Experience with Java programming
Experience with Javascript platforms like ReactJS, Node.js, Next.js
Experience with development of digital experience platforms, CMSs, website builders
Experience with data flow automation frameworks like Apache NiFi or exposure/knowledge with workflow engines like jBPM or stream processing platforms like Apache Kafka
Experience with the development and integration of APIs
Experience with development and implementations of projects in the cloud with AWS services (e.g. EC2, S3, ELB, CloudFront)
Experience with CI/CD (GitLab)
Affinity for agile methodologies
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team




Start date: Asap

Show more

The web developer will be responsible for contributing to the implementation of the European Parliament's websites as well as of all supporting applications and platforms essential to ensure the publication of multilingual content on Internet.

  • Programming of software applications
  • Proposition of trending software solutions and applications, best suited to the functional and technological needs

The following qualifications, experience and skills are required:


  • Excellent knowledge in web development with various frameworks and platforms like SpringBoot
  • Experience with Java programming
  • Experience with Javascript platforms like ReactJS, Node.js, Next.js
  • Experience with development of digital experience platforms, CMSs, website builders
  • Experience with data flow automation frameworks like Apache NiFi or exposure/knowledge with workflow engines like jBPM or stream processing platforms like Apache Kafka
  • Experience with the development and integration of APIs
  • Experience with development and implementations of projects in the cloud with AWS services (e.g. EC2, S3, ELB, CloudFront)
  • Experience with CI/CD (GitLab)
  • Affinity for agile methodologies
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team


Start date: Asap

Title: Senior Python Developer
Description:
Why join us?


Learn from top Wall Street experts: you will work in one team with quants and portfolio managers who have 15+ years of experience in the field.
Greenfield development: participate in designing and building an entire tech platform for running the company from scratch. Our oldest code is just 1.5 years old.
Cutting-edge practices: we embrace XP principles like TDD, CI/CD, pair programming, and trunk-based development to ship value daily.
Real challenges: everything you work on gets tested by real users immediately. No boring tasks with unknown value.
Zero bureaucracy: we're a startup, so enjoy minimal bureaucracy.
Small, skilled teams: we’re a crew of 30 experienced engineers, working in small teams of up to 5, so don’t expect communication overload.
True remote: No Return To Office. Work from wherever you want.



What a Python Engineer will do:


Create high-quality code according to Syberry’s standards.
Engineer a solution to the problem of an end user: delivering API services / working with datasets and data pipelines / delivering integrations with external systems (depending on the team).
Closely collaborate and communicate with the client and the team.



About you:


Strong engineering experience (we mean it): we believe at least 5 years of software engineering is a good predictor (however, you can challenge this belief).
Experience working with AWS or any other cloud: can use key services for computation, networking, and storage
Decent mathematics knowledge that you apply to solve complex technical challenges.
Expertise in SQL and RDBMS to write efficient queries and interact with relational databases effectively.
Fluent English: for daily communication with native speakers from the U.S.
Design and implement APIs following best practices to ensure scalability and maintainability.
Develop and maintain Docker containers, including writing custom Docker files for various applications.
Availability until 7 PM CET at least 3 days a week: our product team and end users operate in the Eastern Time Zone, so we need an overlap for effective collaboration. Still, we expect 8h of work daily so you could start later or have breaks.



Will be a plus:


Finance knowledge: no need for deep conceptual understanding, but general knowledge about investment management is a big advantage, specifically equities, back-testing, and financial simulations.
Statistics knowledge is a great advantage.
Experience working with end users/clients directly, figuring out their needs, and delivering end-to-end solutions for them.
You have experience in engineering data pipelines.
You have worked with Flask / Fast API or any other web framework.
You have worked with Kotlin or another backend programming language.

Title: Android Specialist
Description:
Android Specialist

We are looking for a Android Specialist to join our team and collaborate with a prestigious European institution based in Belgium.




Responsibilities:

Provide comprehensive support and troubleshooting for Android applications and devices.
Identify and resolve issues related to various Android UIs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of mobile applications.
Debugging Android phones
Deliver advanced Android support.
Assist in the maintenance and updating of Android apps.
Manage and support privately-owned Android devices used within the organization.




Qualifications:

Proficiency in both French and English for effective communication.
An ITILV4 certification is required (we offer the opportunity to obtain the certification before your start date).
A minimum of 3 years' hands-on experience in a similar position.
Experience in Office Automation, digital workplace, and mobile computing.
Knowledge of Android UI and MS Windows configuration tools, including Active Directory.
A strong understanding of Android devices and software.
Experience with Android app development or support.
Familiarity with Android SDK and related tools.
Knowledge of the mobile development life cycle.
Ability to troubleshoot Android issues effectively.
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.

Title: Full Stack .NET developer/analist (m/v/x)
Description:
Werkomgeving




De CDSCA is een openbare dienst met als opdracht voorzien in de sociale en culturele behoeften van het ministerie van Landsverdediging. Hun IT team is een klein team waar je als IT’er met verschillende domeinen van IT in aanraking kan komen.




Taakomschrijving




Als allround IT’er zorg je voor verschillende uiteenlopen taken zoals :

analyse van noden en uitdenken van een oplossing, rekening houdende met de mogelijke beperkingen


ontwikkeling van nieuwe toepassingen en onderhoud van bestaande toepassingen (VB6 en .Net omgeving)
schrijven van technische documentatie voor de verschillende applicaties
trainen van gebruikers van de applicaties zodat het gebruik hiervan vlot verloopt
je bent het contactpunt voor gebruikers bij problemen
jezelf blijven ontwikkelen door trainingen te volgen en je technische kennis voortdurend te ontwikkelen




Profielomschrijving




je hebt een brede affiniteit met IT en een aangetoonde ervaring in de hierboven vermelde domeinen
je bent leergierig en volgt de evoluties op in de verschillende technologieën die gebruikt worden
je hebt kennis van MS SQL, VB6 en/of VB.NET
Je hebt ervaring met reporting tools, met voorkeur SAP Crystal Reports
Je hebt ervaring met Active directory, API, en Webservices
je bent communicatief sterk
je bent een teamplayer die ook zelfstandig kan functioneren
Bij voorkeur ben je tweetalig (Nederlands, Frans) of, indien niet, beschik je over voldoende kennis van de tweede landstaal om probleemloos te kunnen deelnemen aan vergaderingen met vertegenwoordigers van de gebruikers.
Kennis van het technisch Engels is onontbeerlijk




Wij bieden

Wil je in een boeiende omgeving werken met uitdagingen die verbonden zijn aan de informatisering van diensten en daarbij ook nog een meerwaarde creëren voor de maatschappij ? Dan is een ICT job binnen één van onze openbare diensten een job voor jou. We streven naar een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé (bijvoorbeeld dankzij de mogelijkheid van telewerken, flexibele werkuren, gemakkelijk bereikbare gebouwen) en bieden een marktconform salaris - inclusief een hele reeks extralegale voordelen.




--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




Environnement de travail

L’OCASC est un service public qui a pour mission de répondre aux besoins sociaux et culturels du Ministère de la Défense". Leur équipe IT est une petite équipé, ce qui vous permet, en tant que professionnel de l’informatique de toucher aux différents domaines de l’IT




Description de fonction

En tant que professionnel polyvalent de l’IT, vous gérerez de nombreuses tâches telles que :

L’analyse des besoins et l’élaboration de solutions, en tenant compte des limitations éventuelles
Le développement de nouvelles applications et la maintenance des applications existantes (dans un environnement VB6 et .Net)
La rédaction de documents techniques pour les différentes applications
La formation des utilisateurs des applications afin que leur utilisation se passe bien
Vous serez le point de contact des utilisateurs en cas de problème avec l’application
Vous continuez à développer vos connaissances en suivant des formations afin d’améliorer constamment vos connaissances techniques




Description de profil

Vous avez de belles affinités avec l’IT en général et une expérience dans les domaines listés ci-dessus
Vous aimez apprendre et suivez les évolutions dans les différentes technologies utilisées
Vous avez de bonnes connaissances de MS SQL, VB6 et/ou VB.NET
Vous avez de l’expérience avec les outils de reporting, de préférence avec SAP Crystal Reports
Vous avez de l’expérience avec l’Active Directory, les API et les WebServices
Vous avez de fortes capacités de communication
Vous favorisez l’esprit d’équipe et aimez aussi travailler de façon autonome
Vous êtes de préférence bilingue (français, néerlandais) ou, dans le cas contraire, vous avez une connaissance suffisante de la deuxième langue nationale pour pouvoir participer sans problème aux réunions avec les représentants des utilisateurs.
La connaissance de l'anglais technique est essentielle




Nous offrons

Vous désirez travailler dans un environnement passionnant qui relève les défis liés à la digitalisation et où vous apportez une plus-value sociétale. Dans ce cas, un job ICT au sein d’un de nos services publics est fait pour vous. Nous accordons une grande importance à un équilibre sain entre vie professionnelle et vie privée (par exemple, grâce à la possibilité de télétravail, des horaires flexibles, des bâtiments très accessibles) et nous offrons un salaire conforme au marché assorti de toute une série d’avantages extra-légaux.

Show more
HTML:
Werkomgeving


De CDSCA is een openbare dienst met als opdracht voorzien in de sociale en culturele behoeften van het ministerie van Landsverdediging. Hun IT team is een klein team waar je als IT’er met verschillende domeinen van IT in aanraking kan komen.


Taakomschrijving


Als allround IT’er zorg je voor verschillende uiteenlopen taken zoals :

  • analyse van noden en uitdenken van een oplossing, rekening houdende met de mogelijke beperkingen

  • ontwikkeling van nieuwe toepassingen en onderhoud van bestaande toepassingen (VB6 en .Net omgeving)
  • schrijven van technische documentatie voor de verschillende applicaties
  • trainen van gebruikers van de applicaties zodat het gebruik hiervan vlot verloopt
  • je bent het contactpunt voor gebruikers bij problemen
  • jezelf blijven ontwikkelen door trainingen te volgen en je technische kennis voortdurend te ontwikkelen


Profielomschrijving


  • je hebt een brede affiniteit met IT en een aangetoonde ervaring in de hierboven vermelde domeinen
  • je bent leergierig en volgt de evoluties op in de verschillende technologieën die gebruikt worden
  • je hebt kennis van MS SQL, VB6 en/of VB.NET
  • Je hebt ervaring met reporting tools, met voorkeur SAP Crystal Reports
  • Je hebt ervaring met Active directory, API, en Webservices
  • je bent communicatief sterk
  • je bent een teamplayer die ook zelfstandig kan functioneren
  • Bij voorkeur ben je tweetalig (Nederlands, Frans) of, indien niet, beschik je over voldoende kennis van de tweede landstaal om probleemloos te kunnen deelnemen aan vergaderingen met vertegenwoordigers van de gebruikers.
  • Kennis van het technisch Engels is onontbeerlijk


Wij bieden

Wil je in een boeiende omgeving werken met uitdagingen die verbonden zijn aan de informatisering van diensten en daarbij ook nog een meerwaarde creëren voor de maatschappij ? Dan is een ICT job binnen één van onze openbare diensten een job voor jou. We streven naar een gezonde balans tussen werk en privé (bijvoorbeeld dankzij de mogelijkheid van telewerken, flexibele werkuren, gemakkelijk bereikbare gebouwen) en bieden een marktconform salaris - inclusief een hele reeks extralegale voordelen.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Environnement de travail

L’OCASC est un service public qui a pour mission de répondre aux besoins sociaux et culturels du Ministère de la Défense". Leur équipe IT est une petite équipé, ce qui vous permet, en tant que professionnel de l’informatique de toucher aux différents domaines de l’IT


Description de fonction

En tant que professionnel polyvalent de l’IT, vous gérerez de nombreuses tâches telles que :

  • L’analyse des besoins et l’élaboration de solutions, en tenant compte des limitations éventuelles
  • Le développement de nouvelles applications et la maintenance des applications existantes (dans un environnement VB6 et .Net)
  • La rédaction de documents techniques pour les différentes applications
  • La formation des utilisateurs des applications afin que leur utilisation se passe bien
  • Vous serez le point de contact des utilisateurs en cas de problème avec l’application
  • Vous continuez à développer vos connaissances en suivant des formations afin d’améliorer constamment vos connaissances techniques


Description de profil

  • Vous avez de belles affinités avec l’IT en général et une expérience dans les domaines listés ci-dessus
  • Vous aimez apprendre et suivez les évolutions dans les différentes technologies utilisées
  • Vous avez de bonnes connaissances de MS SQL, VB6 et/ou VB.NET
  • Vous avez de l’expérience avec les outils de reporting, de préférence avec SAP Crystal Reports
  • Vous avez de l’expérience avec l’Active Directory, les API et les WebServices
  • Vous avez de fortes capacités de communication
  • Vous favorisez l’esprit d’équipe et aimez aussi travailler de façon autonome
  • Vous êtes de préférence bilingue (français, néerlandais) ou, dans le cas contraire, vous avez une connaissance suffisante de la deuxième langue nationale pour pouvoir participer sans problème aux réunions avec les représentants des utilisateurs.
  • La connaissance de l'anglais technique est essentielle


Nous offrons

Vous désirez travailler dans un environnement passionnant qui relève les défis liés à la digitalisation et où vous apportez une plus-value sociétale. Dans ce cas, un job ICT au sein d’un de nos services publics est fait pour vous. Nous accordons une grande importance à un équilibre sain entre vie professionnelle et vie privée (par exemple, grâce à la possibilité de télétravail, des horaires flexibles, des bâtiments très accessibles) et nous offrons un salaire conforme au marché assorti de toute une série d’avantages extra-légaux.

Title: Java Software Engineer
Description:
Aerospace Company – Java Engineer – Brussels

I am working with an Aerospace client in Brussels that are looking for a strong Java Engineer to join their payroll. The want someone with a strong mathematical or analytical approach to join them. You would be working with a great deal of data and algorithms as well. If you love a puzzle, this would be perfect for you.




Profile:

Java has no mysteries for you
Strong grasp of the Spring ecosystem
Ability to manage your own time and work (due to the mostly remote nature of the role)
Spoken Language: English
Analytical and problem solving mindset




Bonus Skills:

Aerospace industry experience (not a necessity)
Microservices knowledge: AWS / Kubernetes / Docker
JavaScript / TypeScript knowledge
General Oracle database skills
Someone who can speak French or Dutch is a plus




Package:

5,000 – 7,000 gross (depending on seniority and position)
Company Car, Fuel, Insurance, Meal vouchers, Expense account all negotiable
Flexible company culture (remote working has always been in the company's DNA)




If interested, please apply to this position and your profile will be submitted to the portal. If you have any additional questions, please contact me on the following details: Zachary.harvey-wright@vividresourcing.com or +32 2 320 14 00.
