Title: Researcher European Health Data Space
Description:
The Belgian Institute of Health (Sciensano) provides support for health policy through scientific research, expert opinions and divisional tasks. On the basis of scientific research, we formulate recommendations and solutions for a proactive health policy at the Belgian, European and international levels; assess the status of health (indicators) within a certified quality framework; and develop advanced solutions for the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of current and emerging diseases.




You will strengthen the team of the EU Health Information System unit of the Scientific Directorate Data Governance. The unit strengthens the exchange and reuse of health information in Belgium and Europe. Through European and national projects, this unit also contributes to the shaping of the European Health Data Space (EHDS) for secondary use. You will strengthen the research team, responsible for contributing to various tasks in these project, mainly focussing on designing and optimizing infrastructures for the processing of health data.

You will be participating in the Joint Action Towards the European Health Data Space (TEHDAS) that aims to develop guidelines and technical specifications for common use by all Members States and the European Commission, towards implementing the EHDS on secondary use of health data.

More specifically, you will set up and lead international working groups on 1) which datasets are in scope of the European Health Data Space; and 2) discussions centred on validating and finetuning the metadata properties crucial for enhancing health data description. For this, you have regular contacts with partner institutions, the European Commission and other international and national partners and actors.

Furthermore, you will work towards guidelines for coorporation and collaboration between Health Data Access Bodies (HDABs, as defined in the EHDS regulation) and other parties, such as data holders, data users, other HDABs and EU level bodies.

Finally, you are expected to look for funding opportunities and take a lead in the drafting of project proposals to win European projects. You are able to quickly identify potential connections and synergies of funding opportunities with upcoming and running health initiatives in the unit. You contribute to communication about the projects and programmes, and our services and to relevant stakeholders, supported by our communications officer. You write scientific publications based on the work in the unit.




Master’s degree in data science, information sciences, health or social, (bio)medical sciences, (bio)statistics, or similar. PhD in a health-related subject is a plus. 2-3 years’ experience in developing and carrying out European projects (in data science/health (information) systems/healthy policy or other relevant fields)
Experienced in data privacy and security, FAIR principle implementation and data interoperability improvement.
Good knowledge of European health information data and healthcare systems, European and international institutions and agencies, and of scientific work in support of policy.
Experienced in project management, technical and functional documentation, and in organising meetings or workshops.
Language skills: Good knowledge of English. Dutch and/or French is an asset.
Demonstrated experience in analyzing and solving problems and a thorough attention to detail; Commitment to continuous improvement; Comfortable working in a team environment, both online and offline.
General skills: scientific mind, open to self-development, excellent drafting skills, able to establish and maintain networks, good management skills, good organisation and coordination skills.




An interesting position in a renowned scientific institute.
A fixed-term employment contract (one year, starting date asap), which may be extended after a favourable evaluation.
Pay scale: SW1
Benefits: free season ticket or 100% reimbursement for home-work journeys by public transport; hospital/group insurance; meal vouchers; various benefits via FED + (www.fedplus.be); social benefits
Other: flexible working hours of 38 hours/week; teleworking and training opportunities.




Apply through our website before 10/09/2024 https://www.sciensano.be/en/working-sciensano/my-employment-opportunities !

If you have further questions or for more details regarding this opportunity, contact Jobcenter via jobs@sciensano.be.

Title: Security Engineer
Description:
As I am sure you have seen and heard in the news regarding the Crowdstrike Incident last month. This was a major disruption for my client in the banking sector which has led to a significant amount funding being invested into various departments within the cloud, Cyber and network departments.




In the last two weeks i have placed two externals consultants into the IAM and Cloudflare department. Ideally if you have a strong knowledge in Cloud security, IAM, Cyber Security and/or Network Security the manager is open to holding initial talks later next week. The role is English speaking with a maximum of 4-6 days on site a month.




If you are interested to know more about this role please send me your most up to date CV and we can arrange a call?




Kind regards,

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description:
Je functie

• Als DevOps Engineer sta je mee in voor het automatiseren, optimaliseren en onderhouden van de tools die gebruikt worden door de operationele en ontwikkelingsdiensten.

• Je werkt mee aan de analyse en de implementatie van de ontwikkelingsprocessen.

• Je werkt projectmatig en volgens de afgesproken planning.

• Je staat mee in voor de kwaliteit en de ondersteuning van de opgeleverde tools en processen.




Je profiel

Je beschikt over een bachelor in de Informatica en hebt bij voorkeur ervaring als DevOps Engineer of je hebt al ervaring als full stack ontwikkelaar en/of system engineer en bent bereid om bij te leren.
Je kan je weg vinden in applicaties die geschreven zijn met behulp van .NET Core en Angular.
Je hebt een basiskennis SQL.
Je bent vertrouwd met tools zoals Visual Studio Code, Git, NuGet, NPM, Powershell.
Kennis van Terraform is een pluspunt.
Kennis van Jenkins is een pluspunt.
Kennis van het Azure platform is een pluspunt.
Je bent oplossingsgericht, communicatief, stressbestendig, flexibel en bezit een goede teamgeest.
Je bent communicatief vaardig in het Engels en Nederlands of Frans.




Je werkomgeving

De informatica-afdeling van Solidaris bestaat uit een 200-tal IT-ers die toepassingen ontwikkelen voor alle aangesloten ziekenfondsen, hun loketten (800) en binnendiensten, verspreid over heel België. Deze toepassingen worden gebruikt door meer dan 3500 personen en maken dagelijksongeveer 4 miljoen transacties.




Ons aanbod

Betekenisvol werk: Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van de gezondheid en het welzijn van mensen. Je kunt trots zijn op het feit dat je een positieve impact hebt op het leven van anderen.
Professionele ontwikkeling: Wij bieden een stimulerende omgeving waarin je je professioneel kunt ontwikkelen. Er zijn tal van mogelijkheden voor training, vorming en loopbaangroei, zodat je je vaardigheden voortdurend kunt verbeteren en je carrière kunt laten evolueren.
Flexibiliteit en balans: Wij begrijpen het belang van een gezonde balans tussen werk en privéleven. Een 36 uren werkweek met vrije namiddag, 6 adv-dagen, extra legale verlofdagen die meegroeien met jouw anciënniteit, glijdende werkuren en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk bieden een omgeving die rekening houdt met jouw behoeften.
Uitgebreide voordelen: Naast het salarispakket zijn er diverse extra-legale voordelen, waaronder maaltijdcheques, groepsverzekering, vergoeding van woon/werkverkeer (aan tarief openbaar vervoer), een hospitalisatieverzekering, mogelijkheid tot fietsleasing en verschillende personeelskortingen.
Samenwerking en teamgeest: Er heerst een sterke teamgeest en er zijn regelmatig activiteiten en evenementen om de onderlinge band te versterken.




Selectieprocedure

Op basis van je motivatiebrief en CV gebeurt een eerste selectie.

Zo krijg je meteen antwoord en plannen we eventueel een gesprek in.




Interesse?

Solliciteren doe je via onze jobsite

Voeg zeker ook je cv en motivatiebrief toe.




Voor bijkomende inlichtingen contacteer je Ronny De Haes (Ronny.DeHaes@solidaris.be).




Meer info

Voor algemene informatie over Solidaris ga je naar www.solidaris-vlaanderen.be. Volg ons ook op LinkedIn en Twitter.

Wij moedigen iedereen aan om te solliciteren. Kwaliteiten en competenties zijn belangrijker dan afkomst, leeftijd, geslacht of arbeidshandicap.

Ons ziekenfonds engageert zich voor de gezondheid en het welzijn van iedereen. Dagelijks ijveren wij voor een toegankelijke en betaalbare ziekteverzekering. Want ... Iedereen mee.

Title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
Description:
BWC is looking a "Cloud DevOps Engineer " for its client in Brussels, Belgium.

Its a full time - permanent contract with BWC.




Requirements:

BWC is looking a "Cloud DevOps Engineer " for its client in Brussels, Belgium.

Its a full time - permanent contract with BWC.




Functional description:

Developing and maintaining CI/CD processes of cloud-based solutions
Configuring, managing, and maintaining tools to automate operational processes.
Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes.
Maintain existing tools for monitoring, notifications, trending, and analysis.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in development, test, and production instances.
Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats.
Building, maintaining, and monitoring configuration standards.
Handle code deployments in all environments.
Provide technical guidance and educate team members and co-workers on development and operations.
Document and design various processes, update existing processes, and innovate for better process improvements.




Requirements:

Proven experience in DevOps engineering and agile software development.
Experience with tools like Azure DevOps, Git, ArgoCD, and SonarQube.
Worked with infrastructure technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Helm
Strong experience with Linux-based infrastructures.
Hands-on experience with platforms including SQL Server, MongoDB, Kong, and Databricks.
Knowledge of Azure cloud provider and services.
Must be able to code and script in various languages (Python, PowerShell, Azure CLI, shell)
Understanding of system monitoring tools and automated testing frameworks.
Knowledge of secure coding practices and experience with security testing tools.
Excellent communication and presentation skills and the ability to work well in a team.
Fluent in English and one in of the following languages German, Dutch or French.
Possible travel to Berlin,




Interested candidate please send the CV to :

Preeti@bigwater.consulting

Pk@bigwater.consulting







Interested candidate please send the CV to :

Preeti@bigwater.consulting

Pk@bigwater.consulting

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist in Zurich, Switzerland




Location - Zurich (Hybrid)

Role- Data Scientist (Permanent)

Industry - Consulting

(Python, R, TensorFlow)




Are you a Data Scientist with 5+ years of experience, ready to take on exciting challenges? If you have a passion for data analysis, predictive modeling, and driving business impact, we want you on our team in Zurich!




The ideal Data Scientist will have:

Experience: 5+ years in data science, with a strong background in statistical modeling and machine learning.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, R, and TensorFlow
Innovative Mindset: A creative problem-solver who can turn raw data into impactful insights.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

A US-Swiss startup, which embarked on a mission to fully automate business finance function, is looking for top-performing and passionate Data Scientist.




Responsibilities

Develop and deploy solutions for automating finance processes and solving business problems using LLMs, AI agents, and predictive modeling techniques.
Execute end-to-end the data science process: from understanding business requirements, data discovery and extraction, model development and evaluation (LLM fine-tuning & RAG), to production implementation.
Lead, mentor, develop, and coach high-performing team, work actively to enhance the capabilities of the team and play a key role in attracting, developing, and retaining talent.
Provide expertise to simplify processes and evolve human experiences affected by interactions between data, algorithms, context, logic and interfaces.
Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. 




Qualifications

5+ years of experience with end-to-end ML systems, including data processing, feature engineering and tuning of ML models, including LLM fine-tuning, in training and production - with both structured and unstructured data. 
Proven and successful track record of leading high-performing data analyst teams. Effective leadership and coaching skills.
Deep knowledge of statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB, pandas, TensorFlow) and database languages (e.g., SQL).
MS/PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or equivalent technical fields. 
Very good verbal and written English communication skills.




If you

want to invest your time and talent in creation of the future, where finance function is fully automated and drives business through deep-dive real-time analytics, modeling, and predictions;
have a constant desire for learning and development as well as strong motivation for continuous improvement;
feel intense itching for building simple and elegant solutions;
like to work in a fun environment, be challenged and recognized for what you bring to the team, and be compensated based on company’s success;

then please apply for this position or e-mail to info@robotif.ai

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
La Division Watches & Fine Jewelry de Chanel développe et renforce actuellement ses capacités en Data Science. Dans le cadre de notre développement et de notre transformation numérique, nous recherchons un/e Data Scientist expérimenté pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique et innovante sous la supervision du Data Science Manager.

En tant que Data Scientist, vous serez responsable de l'analyse des données complexes et de la fourniture d'insights stratégiques pour aider à la prise de décision. Vous serez chargé de collecter et de préparer les données, d'appliquer des techniques d'exploration de données, des algorithmes d'apprentissage automatique, d'effectuer des analyses statistiques et de construire des systèmes de prédiction pour renforcer et automatiser nos processus opérationnels. Votre rôle sera transversal et vous travaillerez en collaboration avec les membres de l'équipe des départements Opérations, Marketing, IT & Finance mais aussi avec d'autres équipes au sein de nos différents Marchés & Régions.

Poste à pourvoir dès que possible pour 12 mois à Genève

Vos principales responsabilités :



Collecter, traiter et nettoyer des données provenant de sources multiples.
En tant que Data Scientist au sein de la division Watches & Fine Jewelry, vous ferez partie de l'équipe de Data Science, travaillant sous la direction d'un Lead Data Scientist. Votre rôle consistera à contribuer aux projets de la division et à soutenir la stratégie d'évolution Machine Learning pour l'optimisation de nos opérations.



Vos missions incluront :

Participer à l'implémentation de la stratégie d'évolution Machine Learning de la division en collaboration avec le reste de l'équipe.

Assister dans le suivi des projets et contribuer au déploiement itératif en production.

Collaborer avec les différentes équipes de la maison Chanel pour mener à bien les projets de Data Science.

Vos principales responsabilités :

Contribuer à la construction et à l'automatisation des pipelines de données.

Analyser et présenter les résultats des modèles de manière claire à différents publics.

Participer activement aux projets transverses concernant la Supply Chain, les Opérations et la Production.

Votre profil :

Compétences solides en Python et en SQL.

Titulaire d'un Master en Data Science, Informatique, Ingénierie, Mathématiques ou domaine équivalent.

Compréhension approfondie de la théorie de la data science et capacité à l'appliquer dans un contexte professionnel.

Aptitude à communiquer l'importance de la Data Science en entreprise à divers interlocuteurs.

Connaissance des plateformes et environnements Cloud (Azure, GCP, etc.).

Capacité à travailler en équipe et à communiquer efficacement avec les collègues et les parties prenantes.

Une expérience précédente dans le domaine du Machine Learning est souhaitée. Application à la Supply Chain ou une expérience dans la vente de détail ou l'industrie du luxe serait un plus.

Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français, à l'écrit comme à l'oral.



Ce rôle est idéal pour un/e Data Scientist dynamique et passionné, désireux de contribuer à l'innovation et à l'efficacité opérationnelle au sein d'une division prestigieuse.



De la singularité de chacun naît la richesse de nos équipes. CHANEL valorise la diversité sous toutes ses formes et s’engage à traiter équitablement chaque candidature.
Show more

Title: Oncology Data Science
Description:
For our client, a leading company in the Pharma industry, we are currently looking for an Oncology Data Science




Background:

We are seeking a highly motivated contractor to join our client's Oncology Data Science Group for a 6-month position. The successful candidate will work on translational questions, including data quality control (QC), pipeline processing, and data exploration. This role requires knowledge in NGS analysis and the generation of Shiny or Dash applications




Tasks and Responsibilities:

Perform data quality control and processing of bioinformatics pipelines and report
Conduct data exploration and analysis to address translational research questions.
Explore and integrate multi omics public datasets to enable meta-analysis and mining.
Develop Shiny or Dash applications for data visualization.
Ensure reproducible coding practices and maintain detailed documentation.




Your Profile:

MSc with 2+ years of experience or PhD in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or a related field.
Experience in next-generation sequencing (NGS) data processing.
Preferred experience in genomics/transcriptomics data processing (as patient cfDNA analysis and scRNAseq)
Strong coding skills in R or Python.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks effectively and work collaboratively in a team environment.




Nice to Haves:

Experience with Shiny or Dash application development.
Familiarity with additional bioinformatics tools and databases.

Title: Data Scientist Trading Analytics
Description:
Responsibilities

Build data infrastructure for Trading Analytics, including Databases and Data Lake
Develop Machine Learning and Financial models for Trading Execution, Market Making, and Sales
Ensure data quality, including mining, cleansing, and analyzing large datasets for use-case development
Write code and algorithms, mainly in Python and Scala
Create software applications, user interfaces, APIs, dashboards, and automated reports for business users
Build systems for collection and transformation of large data sets to enable model development
Assist with the execution of Big Data solutions and related technologies
Present results from AI and Financial models to stakeholders
Collaborate with Data Architects, Developers, and Business Developers to jointly meet deadlines




Requirements

Several years of experience as a Data Scientist
Proven knowledge of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Good knowledge of Mathematical Finance and Financial Markets
Knowledge of Data Architecture, Databases and Data Lakes
Advanced coding skills in Python, R, Matlab
Knowledge of C++, Haskell, Scala and/or Java
Fluent in English




Nice to have

Knowledge of Spark, Databricks, Kafka, and real-time analytics
Knowledge of PowerBI, Tableau, and VBA
Knowledge of Webapp Development, Docker, Kubernetes, Git, and Dash (or similar)
Knowledge of Cloud Computing (MS Azure or Snowflake)




Personality

Good communication and presentation skills
Team player and service-oriented personality
Structured working style

Title: ML/AI Engineer
Description:
PLEASE NOTE: This position is based in our Swiss HQ in Mendrisio, Switzerland, just 7km over the border from Como, Italy. Mendrisio is easily commutable from Milan, Como, Varese or Lugano and QA Ltd provides the train ticket for you! We are also happy to assist with your relocation to this beautiful part of Europe.







About Us

At QA, we believe the future belongs to organisations that are able to learn, master and apply new skills at pace and scale. As the largest tech training company in the UK and the fastest-growing in the US, we partner with 96% of the FTSE and most of the Fortune500. We have served over 4,000 customers and 1+ million learners since 1985

.We believe skills alone aren’t enough but need to be applied back to the business to effect change. We do this through tailored learning programmes that connect learning across an organisation’s siloes, create continuity for learners, and feature collaborative, cohort-based modalities to apply skills at pace and at scale. Our unique end-to-end learning solution draws from deep expertise across apprenticeships, instructor-led training, and self-paced learning. QA is headquartered in London and New York. Learn more at QA.com




About the role

We are expanding our dedicated Data & Machine Learning Team and seeking a highly motivated, self-driven ML/AI Engineer. The ideal candidate is passionate about applying critical thinking and creativity to real-world data, developing data-driven applications using machine learning, NLP, and LLMs, and processing both structured and unstructured data to extract insights and support business decisions.

The team works closely with various stakeholders across the organization, including Engineering, Product, Customer Success, and Finance. Additionally, the team actively collaborates with universities and researchers.




The team works on numerous projects that leverage AI and data-driven approaches to enhance the user experience for our customers and optimize internal operations and processes. These projects include:




AI-powered learning assistants
AI-powered assistance and automation in content management
UX personalization through content recommendations
Skills assessment to measure and address users' knowledge gaps
Detection of fraudulent activities on the platform
Extraction of insights through data analysis




The candidate will contribute to existing and new projects, also interacting and collaborating with stakeholders to understand requirements, define interfaces, communicate progress, and ensure successful adoption.




Requirements

B.Sc/M.Sc in a quantitative field
3+ years of experience in the role
Experience with Natural Language Processing
Experience applying Large Language Models (LLMs) in real-world text-based applications (e.g., Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), prompt optimization)
Proficiency in Python for Data Science (e.g., pandas, numpy/scipy, sklearn) and Machine Learning algorithms (e.g., logistic regression, random forests, etc.)
Good understanding of statistics fundamentals and exploratory data analysis
Familiarity with DevOps concepts, including microservices, CI/CD pipelines, and version control; experience in modularizing software logic into components that communicate via APIs; accustomed to peer code reviews.
Good level of English proficiency, both spoken and written
Strong debugging and root cause analysis skills
Ability to manage and interpret ambiguous requirements
Attention to metrics and demonstrable results
Interest in building and maintaining services that strongly integrate with a user-facing product







Benefits

Competitive compensation and a bonus plan
Four weeks of paid vacation per year (that increases to five weeks after two years with the company!) plus two days off per year to volunteer at your favorite non-profit
Train subscription paid by the company
Relocation bonus







Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to fostering diversity and inclusion. We ensure all applicants are treated fairly, without discrimination based on sex, race, ethnicity, religion, disability, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Title: Data Scientist / Large Language Model (LLM) Specialist
Description:
We are in search of a talented researcher/machine learning specialist to join our team as a Data Scientist with a focus on Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate will possess a high level of proficiency in data science and demonstrate a strong emphasis on leveraging large language models. This person should have a deep technical understanding of machine learning, complemented by solid programming skills. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and models, with a specific emphasis on large language models incl. agents, fine-tuning, new transformers-based architectures.
Stay updated and share advancement on the state of the art.
Participate in local academic partnerships, and ideally develop and drive them.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to (a) share expertise and advice, and (b) implement some of the advanced solutions developed to solve complex business challenges.
More generally, contribute to the innovation and advancement of machine learning capabilities within the organization.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services will be considered a valuable asset.







Qualifications:

A solid background as a researcher and/or data scientist, or a strong interest in technical excellence and machine learning innovation.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and data science is mandatory. In-depth knowledge of natural language processing and in particular large language models is highly appreciated.
Exposure to the LLM’s ecosystem and associated frameworks.
Proficiency of Python, Jupyter Notebook and popular neural network frameworks (Tensorflow and/or PyTorch), along with a good understanding of software engineering principles.
Experience in training Machine Learning models on large data sets.
Open to continuous improvement of Data Science skills: we are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our Data Science team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let’s talk about the role!




As a Data Scientist at VF Corporation, you’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You’ll work on challenging problems, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and drive data-driven decision-making for all the functions and brands of VF Corporation.




We expect that you will deliver unbeatable results whilst fulfilling the following aspects of the Data Scientist role:




Develop predicting models in the area of DTC marketing.
Develop models in the area of supply and demand chain.
Monitor and maintain the already deployed models to ensure that the performances remain outstanding.
Present the results to our internal stakeholders.
Have a continuous dialogue with Data Engineers and DevOps to drive new development in the area of model productionalization.




Skills For Success

A successful Data Scientist will be able to bring his contribution in the whole Data Science development chain.




Starting from capturing the right request from the business stakeholders, talking with Data Engineers to retrieve the right data, developing the best model, and presenting the results to the Data Science management and to stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Python Proficiency: demonstrated ability to write efficient, clean Python code for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Data Science and Machine Learning: strong understanding of core ML concepts (clustering, classification, regression, dimensionality reduction).
Time Series Forecasting: extensive experience with time series forecasting methods (statistical, ML, and DL).
Deep Learning and Generative AI: knowledge of main neural network topologies for computer vision and natural language modeling (CNNs, RNNs, autoencoders, transformers, LLMs, diffusion models, RAG, etc.).
Hyperparameter Optimization: Familiarity with best practices (e.g., Bayesian optimization).
Statistical Analysis: Solid grasp of hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and statistical modeling.
Querying and DBs: Deep knowledge of SQL; familiarity with other languages is a plus.
Nice to have: knowledge of recommender systems.




Tools and Platforms:

Version Control: Proficiency with Git for version control and collaboration.
AWS Ecosystem: Experience with AWS services (e.g., Sagemaker, Redshift, Bedrock) is a plus.
Data Visualization: Familiarity with PowerBI or Tableau for presenting project results.




Soft Skills:

Adaptability: Ability to react swiftly to changes and adapt to evolving requirements.
Self-Organization: Strong organizational skills to manage tasks effectively and meet deadlines.
Teamwork: Positive, proactive attitude toward collaboration.
Communication: Fluency in English. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience: Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
Experience in retail will be considered as a plus.




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.

We expect that you will deliver unbeatable results whilst fulfilling the following aspects of the Data Scientist role:


  • Develop predicting models in the area of DTC marketing.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
End of studies internship

Start date: September 2024

Duration: 6 months

“Join us to unleash the power of #data, leverage our cloud platforms and deploy state-of-the-art initiatives at scale! You will be part of a young, dynamic and talented team working on analytics and artificial intelligence with real-life, impactful business applications.”

Thomas M.; Chief Data & Analytics Officer

CONTEXT

The Cartier Data Office is a team of 25 people working on data-driven solutions for various domains in the Maison, including supply chain, manufacturing, communication, and marketing.

As Data Scientists, we discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, help domains make smarter decisions and automate processes. Our primary missions are to perform data analysis, apply machine learning techniques and develop production level models served through custom applications. We strive to keep innovation at the heart of everything we do, exploring novel business solutions and technologies. We work hand in hand with data, cloud, machine learning and analytics engineers, as well as business stakeholders, to ensure that we deliver maximal value to the Maison.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a data scientist intern to work on a panel of different machine learning challenges. These challenges come from the specificities of the hard luxury sector such as rarely sold precious articles, regional differences, and one-time customers. You will work hand in hand with the different stakeholders, to deliver state-of-the-art solutions from ideation to production. You will be responsible for the development of an innovative solution with immediate impact, the subject of which is to be defined together with the business. Previous and current projects cover many areas such as sales forecasting, client segmentation, manufacturing processes optimization, stock allocation and generative AI uses cases.

Your Responsabilities


Perform a literature review to ensure that your work is scientifically grounded and at the forefront of innovation
Discuss findings and algorithm design with the rest of the team
Develop a robust and scalable product that satisfies the business needs
Evaluate its performance and collaborate with the business team
Release your algorithm into production with our machine learning engineers


Required Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, or equivalent quantitative fields
Scientific mindset: rigor in experimentation and a strong interest in developing state-of-the-art models
Solid theoretical background in statistics and machine learning
Strong Python and SQL programming skills
Proficiency with standard ML/Bayesian frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, PyMC, etc.) and data processing libraries
Excellent communication skills
Team player, self-motivated and fast learner


Desired Skills


Several projects and/or internship experience in data science
Experience in the luxury sector
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (VertexAI, BigQuery, etc.)
Experience with git and GitHub
Experience with Docker


YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will reach out to you ASAP for an informal introductory call. The next step will be an introductory call with one of our Data Scientists, followed by a technical interview and a business case.

Title: Python Developer (Data engineering and ML) 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

You are a skilled Python Developer with expertise in statistical analysis and data engineering, seeking to join a team focused on developing cutting-edge customer-facing solutions in computer vision and biometrics. At PXL Vision, you'll play a key role in building sustainable, scalable, and robust Machine Learning models, along with the data pipelines and analytics that power PXL Vision’s digital identity technology stack.

Contract length: 6 months starting from January 2025

What You Bring


Contribute to the design and architecture of our Machine Learning models to ensure they are robust, scalable, and maintainable
Integrate new Machine Learning methods and apply scientific rigor to experimentally evaluate their performance on real-world data
Design and manage upstream data pipelines to efficiently gather, preprocess, and transform data for Machine Learning model training
Design and manage downstream pipelines to monitor and analyze the performance of deployed models in production environments
Stay current with industry trends and technologies to continuously improve the software development process and product quality


Requirements


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min. 3 years of experience in software development in Python, with a focus on machine learning and data engineering.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++ or Java is a plus.
Background in statistical analysis and data engineering, ideally related to the development of Machine Learning solutions
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills and excellent command of English.
Some travel might be required (in Switzerland)


Trusted Role: High security clearances is needed for this role

Why us?


Flexible working hours & hybrid location model
You can help shape things with us and fully contribute your creativity
We are enthusiastic, international and a diverse team with a flat hierarchy
Annual training/further education budget of up to EUR 1,500
Language courses budget up to EUR 1'500


About Us

PXL Vision is the Swiss market leader and premium provider of identity verification for companies. Based on artificial intelligence, PXL Vision offers a highly flexible, modular and configurable software platform for secure and fully automated identity verification to meet complex requirements worldwide.

We aim to develop innovative, secure and reliable identity verification solutions, always with our customers in mind.

The company is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and operates throughout Europe.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Who We Are

Novelis is driven by its purpose to shape a sustainable world together.

As a global leader in innovative products and services and the world's largest recycler of aluminum, we partner with customers in the automotive, beverage can , aerospace and specialties industries to deliver solutions that improve the benefits of balanced lightweight aluminum.

We have a coordinated network of technically sophisticated rolling and recycling plants as well as foundries across 3 2 facilities in 9 countries throughout North America, South America, Europe, and Asia with 13,1 9 0 employees worldwide. The company is headquartered in Atlanta, USA.

Our customers include some of the largest and best-known brands in the world, including Coca-Cola, Ford, BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Airbus, Boeing, Nespresso, Samsung, and others. In addition, Novelis is leading the industry with its sustainability and recycling efforts.

Become part of our mission to create a sustainable world and start as soon as possible at one of our locations in Switzerland (Sierre or Küsnacht) or Germany (Göttingen) as :

(Senior) Data Scientist (f/m/d)

Responsibilities & Qualifications

Novelis is looking for a (Senior) Data Scientist to join our Global Digital Team with a focus on Supply Chain and Operations. In this role you will be responsible for applying advanced statistical analysis tools and Advanced Analytics techniques such as Machine Learning, Mathematical Optimization, Simulation, Computer Vision to explain operating behaviors, understand complex relationships between known and unknown drivers of performance, and build algorithms using advanced descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive methods. This will aid in the optimization of operations by improving the plant operating team’s ability to predict, prevent, or respond to events and/or operating conditions in the most optimal manner.

Your Responsibilities


You collaborate with translators to define technical problem statements and hypothesis to test as well as understanding business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
You coordinate with SMEs, translators, IT and data engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
You design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
You regularly test and maintain analytical models to improve efficiency and keep up with changing business needs, ensuring timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time
You write reports articulating the analytics insights and their business impact
You conduct and lead meetings and workshops to explain findings
You support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models and solutions developed


How You Convince Us


You have a Bachelor’s Degree in in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or industrial engineering with a focus on operations research or significant experience in advanced analytics such as Machine Learning, Mathematical Optimization, Simulation, Computer Vision; Master’s or PhD is a plus
You have a minimum of 2 years of experience in using operations research methods like Linear Programming (LP) and Mixed Integer Programming (MIP), ideally in a business context
You are proficient in programming languages such as SQL and Python; experienced in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark is a plus
You are experienced with object-oriented development, coding and testing, and model deployment
You are comfortable in using tools based on Git and preferably working knowledge of cloud computing platforms such as Microsoft Azure, AWS or Google Cloud
You have proficiency in aggregation of large data sets, data modeling, understanding of data structures
You have experience in industrial industry applications or process industries (chemicals, energy, petroleum refining, mining) preferred
You are business fluent in English, German language skills are a plus


What Novelis Offers You


An international working environment with a cooperative culture, room to take additional responsibilities and an open communication through all levels
Strong links to our senior management in Küsnacht and our manufacturing plants all over Europe
An attractive salary with an additional bonus program
Our competitive company pension scheme and a variety of other benefits
Internal and external development programs to support your career aspirations
The opportunity to shape a sustainable world together


Have we caught your interest?

Then become part of our team! We are looking forward to your application!

You can apply easily with your resume via our application system in less than 5 minutes.

We live diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age, sexual orientation, and identity.

Location Profile

Novelis’ Sierre is located in the Valais Switzerland employing around 550 people. It mainly focuses on production of aluminium sheet for the automotive market covering the entire process from casting to finishing. The plant also hosts a world-leading Research & Innovation Center specialized in the development of new automotive sheet alloys surface treatment and joining technologies. In Feburary 2022 together with research institutions and a local energy provider Novelis founded the Net Zero Lab Valais to develop carbon-neutral solutions for aluminium manufacturing. The lab focuses on identifying and implementing innovative solutions to neutralize the carbon footprint of Novelis’ manufacturing operations and neighboring communities starting in Sierre. The Sierre plant supports its community through direct sponsorship of many annual events promoting education sports and culture.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Company: Wyss Center for Bio and Neuroengineering
Description:
AI Research Scientist

Expertise in Deep Learning - Time Series Analysis - (Neuroscience)




Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Company: dEEGtal Insights / Wyss Center

Start date: as soon as possible

Contract duration: 18 months (with potential extension), full time




About the Company:

dEEGtal Insights and the Wyss Center for Bio and Neuroengineering are teaming up to create groundbreaking software that empowers neurologists to diagnose epilepsy at its earliest stages. Our goal is to provide an advanced healthcare tool that transforms patient care. As a candidate, you’ll leverage your artificial intelligence (AI) expertise to analyze electroencephalographic (EEG) and clinical data, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of epilepsy diagnosis. This position, funded by the Wyss Center—a non-profit organization dedicated to accelerating innovative neurotechnologies—offers a unique opportunity to make a real impact. Based in Geneva, Switzerland, you’ll have access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources, fostering interdisciplinary collaborations and advancing medical research. Our mission is to improve the lives of those suffering from mental and neurological disorders. At the end of the 18-month contract, you’ll have the potential to transition to dEEGtal Insights, a dynamic spinoff of the University of Geneva and Geneva University Hospital.




Job Description:

Are you passionate about AI, neuroscience, and making a real-world impact? Join our dynamic team as an AI research scientist specializing in deep learning (DL) and time series processing. In this role, you’ll play a crucial part in designing and implementing AI models for complex temporal signals, with a focus on EEG data to enhance the diagnosis and prognosis of epileptic patients.




Key Responsibilities:

Algorithm Development: Create efficient, accurate, and scalable AI/DL algorithms tailored to electrophysiological time series;
Mentorship: Mentor and support team members in the AI/DL field;
Stay updated: Keep up with the latest advancements in AI, DL, and signal processing, and share findings at conferences and industry events;
Data Visualization: Develop dashboards to communicate research plans and progress effectively.




Required Qualifications:

Industry Experience: At least 6 years of hands-on experience in AI, DL, foundation models, and time series modeling, with a proven track record of successful implementations. Team management is a plus.
Educational Background: Qualifications in (Bio)electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, C++, and Java.
Collaboration: Ability to work independently and communicate effectively within cross-functional teams.




Preferred Qualifications:

Neuroscientific Knowledge: Familiarity with clinical neuroscience, neural signal processing, and EEG analysis to inform AI model development.
Demonstrated Impact: Achievements in coding competitions, open-source contributions, grants, fellowships, patents, or publications.
Analytical Problem-Solving: Experience using quantitative approaches and thinking outside the box.
Data Handling: Proficiency in manipulating and analyzing complex, high-dimensional data.




What We Offer:

Competitive Compensation: A salary package that reflects your expertise.
Impactful Projects: Work on groundbreaking projects at the intersection of AI, signal processing, and neuroscience.
Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and development, including mentorship programs and support for attending conferences.
Collaborative and innovative work environment in state-of-the-art facilities, where productivity is aligned with happiness and well-being of our collaborators.




How to Apply:

Interested candidates, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, project contributions, problem-solving achievements and any relevant publications or portfolio to HR@wysscenter.ch




Swiss/EU nationality or valid Swiss work permit is required




Application Deadline: 29 September 2024




Show more
HTML:
AI Research Scientist

Expertise in Deep Learning - Time Series Analysis - (Neuroscience)


Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Company: dEEGtal Insights / Wyss Center

Start date: as soon as possible

Contract duration: 18 months (with potential extension), full time


About the Company:

dEEGtal Insights and the Wyss Center for Bio and Neuroengineering are teaming up to create groundbreaking software that empowers neurologists to diagnose epilepsy at its earliest stages. Our goal is to provide an advanced healthcare tool that transforms patient care. As a candidate, you’ll leverage your artificial intelligence (AI) expertise to analyze electroencephalographic (EEG) and clinical data, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of epilepsy diagnosis. This position, funded by the Wyss Center—a non-profit organization dedicated to accelerating innovative neurotechnologies—offers a unique opportunity to make a real impact. Based in Geneva, Switzerland, you’ll have access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources, fostering interdisciplinary collaborations and advancing medical research. Our mission is to improve the lives of those suffering from mental and neurological disorders. At the end of the 18-month contract, you’ll have the potential to transition to dEEGtal Insights, a dynamic spinoff of the University of Geneva and Geneva University Hospital.

  • Educational Background: Qualifications in (Bio)electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields.
  • Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, C++, and Java.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
APPLY HERE: Machine Learning Scientist




If you need assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request form. This form is used only by individuals with disabilities who require assistance or adjustments in applying and interviewing for a job. This form is not for inquiring about a position or the status of an application.

Are you excited about solving real world problems using advanced machine learning at one of the largest online travel companies in the world? If so, we'd like to hear from you!Expedia Group is looking for a Machine Learning Scientist II to join our growing Search & Embeddings ML team that powers search, ranking, travel embeddings and personalized recommendations with state-of-the-art machine learning models for the multiple brands and lines of business in our portfolio.Your work will affect millions of our customers and will have a direct impact on our business results. This is an applied research role: your models will be deployed to our production systems and your results will be measured objectively via A/B testing. We collaborate closely with the analytics, product, and technology teams.




What you’ll do:

Conduct exploratory data analyses, formulate machine learning problems, and build effective models.
Partner with data and software engineering teams to deliver your solutions into production.
Document the technical details of your work.
Collaborate and brainstorm with other team members and across the company.
Present your ideas and results to product management, stakeholders, and leadership teams in a clear and effective manner.
Work with product management to understand business problems, identify challenges and machine learning opportunities, and scope solutions.




Who you are:

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in a related technical field; or equivalent related professional experience
Solid understanding of modern machine learning techniques, statistics, and hypothesis testing
Hands-on experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, model building, and visualization
Familiarity with Python and related machine learning tools, deep learning frameworks such as Keras, TensorFlow or PyTorch, and SQL-like query languages for data extraction, transformation, and loading
Experience working with large data sets in a distributed computing environment such as Spark is a plus.
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Passion for solving interesting and impactful real-world problems using principled techniques and best practices.




About Expedia Group

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

© 2021 Expedia, Inc. All rights reserved. Trademarks and logos are the property of their respective owners. CST: 2029030-50

Employment opportunities and job offers at Expedia Group will always come from Expedia Group’s Talent Acquisition and hiring teams. Never provide sensitive, personal information to someone unless you’re confident who the recipient is. Expedia Group does not extend job offers via email or any other messaging tools to individuals to whom we have not made prior contact. Our email domain is @expediagroup.com. The official website to find and apply for job openings at Expedia Group is careers.expediagroup.com/jobs.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.




We are proud supporters of Women in Data®. Connect, engage and belong to the largest free female data community in the UK – visit: www.womenindata.co.uk to join our community.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
LocationBasel, SwitzerlandBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23545Published27 days ago

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join one of our clients in MedTech. In this role you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models to drive innovation in healthcare solutions. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and clinicians to integrate machine learning into real-world applications that impact patient care.

Responsibilities


Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to solve complex healthcare problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Work with large datasets to train, validate, and optimize machine learning models.
Enhance model performance through techniques such as feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and algorithm optimization.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and security of deployed models in a healthcare environment.



Qualifications


Proven experience in machine learning and data science, within the MedTech sector.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data processing tools.
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, data modeling, and machine learning algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a team-oriented mindset.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Contract: FT

Location: Basel

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
We are on a mission to unlock the power of agentic AI systems by making them secure, trustworthy and reliable.

Our team: Our dedicated and fast-moving team consists of leading AI and security researchers, repeat founders, creators of popular open-source projects, Olympiad gold medalists, and cybersecurity experts. We blend the unique experience at top research institutions such as ETH Zurich, Stanford, and the University of Cambridge and industry leaders such as Facebook, Twitter, Google Brain, Snyk and Adobe.

Who are we looking for: We are assembling a team of top engineers, researchers and builders who can learn and execute quickly and are not afraid to dive deep into cutting-edge products and research. If this sounds like you, we offer an opportunity to make a significant impact both within our company and on the world at large as we tackle together some of the most difficult challenges in AI.

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning, Gemini
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).
Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
Excellent data analysis skills.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.

In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.

A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Research teams to understand technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.
Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.
Conduct data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Exciting Part-Time Opportunity for Data Science Students! (40-80%)
Description:
MDPI Introduction

A pioneer in scholarly open-access publishing, MDPI has been supporting academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms and across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open-access journals, supported by over 35,500 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

Team Introduction / Position

To strengthen our AI team and the Technology Innovation department, we are looking for a working student in Data Science. This is a part-time position based in our city center office in Basel, Switzerland.

As a Data Science Student, you will be responsible for assisting with the development, experimentation, and creation of machine learning, statistical, and advanced mathematical algorithms for various applications, focusing on NLP, Graph Machine Learning, or LLM models. You will also support the analytics team by analyzing data and developing business dashboards for management.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Support the AI team in developing applications in the areas of NLP, LLM, and Graph Machine Learning.
Develop, optimize, and evaluate new machine learning and statistical models.
Explore new approaches and algorithms to solve specific business problems.
Research and compare prototype solutions.


Requirements


Currently enrolled as a BSc or MSc student in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics.
Theoretical and technical knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
Proficiency in Python, including statistical and machine learning libraries (knowledge of other programming languages, such as R, is a plus).
Ability to create dashboards using Streamlit or Shiny is a plus.
Experience with deep learning development frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow) is beneficial.
Experience in applying and implementing NLP and/or Graph Machine Learning is advantageous.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate, document, share, and present ideas and results to both technical and non-technical audiences (fluency in English is required).
A creative team player with a results-oriented mindset.
Strong analytical thinking skills.


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving your complete application. Please submit your cover letter and CV. We are excited about the possibility of welcoming you to our Basel office.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:

https://www.mdpi.com/

https://sciprofiles.com/

https://sciforum.net/

https://www.scilit.net/

https://www.preprints.org/

https://encyclopedia.pub/
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich







My client uses their data platform, multi-modal foundation models, and derived applications, to uncover deep insights within data to transform healthcare delivery and enhance patient outcomes.







They are looking for a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with a strong research background to join their Multimodal Team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in working with vision and language modalities, with a preference for experience in their fusion. While a medical background is a plus, it is not required; their primary focus is on advanced ML engineering capabilities.







Key Responsibilities







Develop and optimize machine learning models for multimodal applications, with a focus on vision and language modalities.
Design and implement scalable machine learning systems, particularly for large-scale distributed training environments.
Utilize PyTorch and PyTorch Lightning to build, train, and deploy ML models, ensuring robust performance and efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into production environments.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, particularly in multimodal and distributed systems.
Participate in code reviews, contribute to the development of best practices, and mentor junior engineers.










Qualifications







Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus but not required.
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, with a focus on vision and language modalities.
Strong background in developing and deploying machine learning models at scale, particularly in distributed settings.
Extensive experience with PyTorch and PyTorch Lightning, including large-scale training and deployment.
Experience in large language model (LLM) training (pre-training or post-training) is highly desirable.

Experience with multimodal fusion techniques.
Familiarity with medical applications of machine learning is a plus, but not mandatory.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Comprehensive salary

25+ days holiday

Title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
Description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. This optimization aims to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capitalize on international market opportunities.

The division serves as the gatekeeper for linear programming (LP) at wholly owned refineries and oversees the integrated global MPIMS model. This model is crucial for optimizing global crude allocation, exploring new international markets, and integrating operational options.

As a Data Scientist, your main role will involve analyzing and structuring large volumes of real-time and historical data. You will build algorithms and solutions around this data to facilitate decision-making within the company. Your work will be pivotal in supporting the company's forecasting and predictive digital strategy, contributing to the development of advanced solutions at the Downstream Digital Center.

Key Responsibilities:

Formulate and lead multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results, and offer previously undiscovered solutions to complex data challenges.
Lead all data experiments tasked by the Data Science Team.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determine root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), Spark, SparkSQL, and HiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long-term data platform architecture.



Requirements:

Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.
Have 5-7 years of professional experience in a related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
Demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
Experience in utilizing visualization tools to leverage the growing volume of available information.
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about creating robust, high-performance systems? We are searching for a talented Python Developer to join our client.




You’ll be involved in building and maintaining mission-critical backend systems that power a high-volume environment. Your work will shape responsive APIs and solve performance challenges that ensure the platform runs smoothly.




In this role, you’ll work alongside a team that is focused on innovation. You’ll be responsible for creating efficient back-end modules, ensuring that they integrate seamlessly with the front-end and perform.




To be able to work and succeed, you need to understand how the system and software architecture works and have good command over the entire process, so architecture experience is preferred. Furthermore, you’ll need more than 5 years of experience in end-to-end software engineering using Python Flask, a solid understanding of Linux, and expertise with Databases (MongoDB, MariaDB, Elasticsearch), and containerization tools like Docker and Kubernetes. The team is looking for someone who’s familiar with REST, web servers, and microservices. Django experience is an advantage.




Just so you know, this position is limited to Swiss citizens, Swiss work permit holders without sponsorship, and residents of the EU/EFTA zone. Visa and permit sponsorship options are not available. Candidates without said requirements cannot be considered.




Step into a role that challenges you and grow. Send your CV to mateja.petrovic@nicollcurtin.com and apply today!

Show more

Title: Vision Developer
Description:
Our client is a company specialized in Micro-Assembly, which designs, develops and builds flexible and modular equipment dedicated to small/very small component assembly and control. They have more than 50 years on the market in the cradle of watchmaking industry. They logically specialized in the assembly and testing of components that require high accuracy and high technology.

Their main activity sectors are: - Watchmaking - Medtech – Semiconductors.

They provide their customers customized, reliable and efficient solutions.




To complete their team and support them in growth, they are recruiting a Vision Developer.

Type of contract: permanent

Workplace Type: Neuchâtel area /Remote

Spoken Languages: French/English




Main Requirements:

You are a HES engineer or a technician in software or automation with good knowledge of vision systems.
You have experience in adjusting vision systems for automatic machines, ideally micro-assembly.
You are located in the Neuchâtel area (including cross-border workers)
You are comfortable with vision equipment (cameras, optics and lighting) to define the vision setups required for applications.
You are comfortable with computers, particularly automatic machine control software (HMI)
You have the basic knowledge to qualify measurement or assembly processes (Metrology and statistics).
You are autonomous and resourceful, loving challenges, technical problem solving and working in an interdisciplinary team.
You want to invest in a family-run, human-sized industrial SME that prioritizes job enrichment over hierarchy and places importance on individual accountability.




Main Responsibilities:

Develop vision applications for machines being adjusted.
Adjust machines being adjusted.
Perform vision feasibility tests.
Provide customer support, after-sales service and internal and external training (10-40%).




Additional skills and knowledge:

Knowledge of Labview software or vision library programming (OpenCV, Halcon, etc.).
You can communicate orally and in writing in English or German.
You have experience or knowledge in artificial intelligence applications.
You are comfortable with mechanics.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer / Robotics
Description:
cryoWrite designs and manufactures robots for microfluid-based protein purification and fast and lossless nanoL grid writing, preparing biomacromolecules, organelles, or cells for visualization by transmissions cryo-EM. The automated sample preparation provided by our robots removes the main remaining bottleneck in a scalable proteomics pipeline, from cell to structure, which will radically transform the drug discovery process.




Key responsibilities

· Add new features and behavioral patterns and protocols to the cryoWriter robot

· Interface and control hardware with ROS2 (rclpy)

· Integration of sensors and actuators (EtherCAT, Serial)

· Frontend development (PyQt or PySide)

· Optimize control with computer vision (OpenCV, GenICam)




Qualifications, skills, and experience

· Strong development skills in python.

· Able to work autonomously, using and extending existing code base

· Experience of interacting with hardware / sensors / actuators.

· Skilled in writing understandable code, in developing and optimizing applications, and in collaborating via Git.

· English mandatory; German optional.

· Ability to communicate logically and precisely, motivated to contribute your insights and to learn from others.




We offer

A challenging and interesting position, working in an innovative startup company that meets the highest standards and has a product far more advanced than the international competition. You will work on your own projects and participate in a collaborative environment with talented and dedicated people. You can expect versatile tasks, flat hierarchies, and you work together with skilled engineers and highly decorated innovators in the field. You will be an essential member of the team, and you will be able to introduce your visions and ideas and utilize your professional skills to the fullest. You will receive share options as part of your compensation and participate in our success.

cryoWrite is located in Basel. We look forward to receiving your application including your complete documents.

Show more
